campaign.story:
Fonts are awesome, but can fonts be experimental or art? Hi, my name is Harald Geisler, I am a Typographer and Artist. With the 2020 Font Collection, I like to share with you my experimental designs about reading and writing for this season.
I like to think about fonts like fashion. The way one dresses written language can be a personal statement. Think about how you dress up going to a party or when you're going to a first date. In the same way, you choose a font when you write a love letter and a different one when you invite your friends to a rad house party.
The struggle with new. Today I find that most "new" fonts are historical revivals honoring the past, for example, the x-th resurrection and hommage to a classic. 
Most of the time classics like Helvetica itself were revolutionary at their time. To stay in the image of clothing: if you pull it off right it can be fun to show off at the party in a 1950s suit. But what is the fitting font for your words this coming season?
Fashion x Fonts. This collection is about exploring possible futures of type design. And I would like this exploration to be fun. The designs of the 2020 Font collection are experimental, fun, pushing writing and readability to its limits.
"Of what use is readability if there is nothing to excite us to take notice of a text?" (W. Weingart 1973)
As an artist, my work often starts with a daydream, in the 2020 font collection I like to work on 5 of these dreams:
1. A font is a portrait of a person
2. Sigmund Freud's handwriting has a nightmare
3. Questioning the way we write with our hands
4. A Miles Davis melody and Andy Warhol philosophy become a font
5. Imagine your personal neutral font
 Can a font be a portrait of a person? Dimanche is Sunday in French. The idea for this font came from getting to know a Japanese dancer who worked in France. We met a couple of times and what remained was a lot of fun memories about movement and the wish to capture this unique character in the design of a typeface. It started with the idea of writing an M that would whimsically bend towards the end, seeing that made me smile and remember. Just like a portrait makes you think of a person, the font makes me think of this encounter. And I like to imagine that each letter carries some of that character and unique movement. The variations of each letter come from the same inspiration. Can you spot all the letter variations in the image? 
Do fonts dream? In 2013 I created a font that renders Sigmund Freud's handwriting here on →Kickstarter. I spend two weeks at the Sigmund Freud Archive in Vienna to analyze the handwriting of the inventor of psychoanalysis. When it comes to creating a handwriting font it is all about understanding the character and patterns of a writer's movement. Now I like to create a dreamlike variation based on the character, movement, and patterns of Prof. Freud's hand. 
 In cursive, all lowercase letters connect. What if… we'd live in a world where all words start with a lower case letter, followed by uppercase letters that are connected. The design explores how to transform the writing-movement for uppercase letters to write a seamless uppercase cursive. Here an early scene from the sketchbook:
Imagine Warhol and Davis had a font. "So What" is inspired by a trick from Andy Warhol and a song from Miles Davis. To create the font I locked myself in the studio listening to Davis' "So What" on repeat for 8 hours. What emerged was a concept for a font drawn in four angles, 8 variations, and an algo-rhythm programmed into the font that exchanges the letters as you type, creating a unique pattern for every word you type. Here are some scenes from the sketchbook: 
Warhol's trick goes like this:
Sometimes people let the same problem make them miserable for years when they could just say: So what.
“My mother didn't love me." So what. “My husband won't ball me.” So what. “I’m a success but I'm still alone." So what.
I don't know how I made it through all the years before I learned how to do that trick. It took a long time for me to learn it, but once you do, you never forget.
Andy Warhol,  →The Philosophy of Andy Warhol, 1975
Stretchgoal:
if the campaign reaches 5050, I will add one more font to the 2020 collection. 
I already used this uppercase typeface for my own T-Shirts, Posters, and Editorial design. And it has beautiful numbers:
→Status of the fonts
Some of the fonts are already in use, some are close to finished, others are still on the drawing board. The delivery of the font collection is planned for September 2020. You will receive instructions and a link to download the fonts.
→Font Guide
You're new to the world of fonts and this is the first time you're buying a Font? This is going to be exciting! With the font-collection comes a helpful font guide covering the first steps to get you started. And if you have font questions along the way, I am happy to help you in person through Kickstarter or email. This is going to be fun!
If you like to try out installing a handwriting font, you can download the →Martin Luther King handwriting font from my website for free. It includes detailed instructions on how to install and use fonts on your computer (PC, Windows, Mac, Linux) or mobile device (iPhone/iPad, Android).
→Technical Details
All fonts of the 2020 collection will be delivered in OpenType format with PostScript outlines. This format is a standard and widely supported by all common operating systems like PC, Mac, Linux, iOS (iPhone or iPad), Android etc. 
Language support • Every language has specific needs, for example in German two dots are placed over vowels (ä,ö,ü) to indicate a modification. The Fonts of the 2020 collection are experimental fonts, which for example can mean that a font may only have uppercase letters. However, it is very important for me to support as many languages as possible — for example when you are from Denmark and like to write København (Copenhagen). Now if the font does not support the letter ø it can not be used for that, which would be sad. So I try to support as many languages as possible.
All fonts are licensed for private (non-commercial) use.
Commercial use: If you are planning to use the font commercially, for example in your design work or in any context that you could describe with "at work" or involves you doing something that you receive money for… please pledge for the commercial license. Thank you. You can read my End User License Agreement here: https://haraldgeisler.com/eula
→Kickstarter References 
If you like to see my other typography Kickstarter projects check out this list:
Fonts:
 Sigmund Freud Typeface • a letter to your shrink 2013   — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/201030759/sigmund-freud-typeface-a-letter-to-your-shrink
   Albert Einstein Font 2015   — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1822548650/albert-einstein-font
   Martin Luther Font 2017   — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/martin-luther-handwriting-font-here-i-write
  😭 Martin Luther King Font 2019 (…did not reach funding goal)  — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/martin-luther-king-font
  Writing Reenactment:
 Kickstarter Gold: Pen Pals—Einstein & Freud 2017 — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/kickstarter-gold-pen-palseinstein-and-freud-handwr
  Typographic Postcards:
 Typographic Postcards #14-26 2015 — https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2108133360/typographic-postcards

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every artistic project bears risks. Every project is new and brings up unforeseeable challenges both technically and artistically. I have published three comparable projects here on Kickstarter (Albert Einstein font, Sigmund Freud Typeface - a letter to your shrink, Martin Luther Font), so I know about the artistic, logistical and technical pitfalls to avoid. The research and preparation that I already made for this project assures me that I will complete this project within the projected timeframe.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backer,
I just wanted to let you know that the first fonts of the 2020 Font Collection are ready to download through https://haraldgeisler.com/my-account/ use the email associated with your Kickstarter to log in. Let me know if you have any questions. 

The zip file will extract after double-clicking to a folder that contains four files:

Dear Backer,
I wanted to keep you in the loop about the 2020 Font Collection. Unfortunately I have to inform you about a delay! My computer broke last week, after 8-years of service. I am pulling out the hard-drives, re-organizing the data, and already ordered a new computer. So far it seems no data is lost. Yet, I am not sure how long the change of computers will take. For now, I am expecting a one / two-week delay to the schedule I shared with you in the last update. While waiting for the new machine to arrive, I am using the meantime to do some of the accounting and paperwork in the studio, which I like to forget.

Dear Backer
Horray!
The 2020 Font Collection is funded. I wanted to let you know about the next steps in the process and when you can expect your Fonts!
Next Steps

campaign.story:
1.5 years after the first successful KS campaign for the original GPIO Card Extended there is now a revised and improved version!
Why
In the last time I've worked a lot with the card and I can say it is working perfectly!
But, yes but...
:-(

... how to remove the card?
Disconnect all cables and then plug them in again without help? Not really, right? Bullshit!
I know the example is simple and easy... ;-) But what when you have 10 or more wires to connect?
While I was thinking about - the brilliant idea came... Why must be holes on the sides?
Slots should work as well...
What
So I developed a new version of the GPIO Card Extended! With slots...
Now you can pull the card out to the side without removing the cables
:-)
The rest remained unchanged. That means the card can still be used in all conceivable configurations... With headers on top, on bottom and as well with old 26 pin and new 40 pin headers. And also not only with Raspberry Pi...
So the GPIO Card Extended V2 was born :-)   For sure a good reason to start a new Kickstarter campaign and worth to share it with you!
GPIO Card Extended V2
History
If you don't know the original version and want more information please see the description in the following links:
original campaign on Kickstarter
gpiocard.ch project page

Stretch goal
Stretch goal at CHF 4500 defined! (more exactly minimum 1000 cards)
If the campaign will reach this goal every backer will get the GPIO Cards in black (PCB) and gold (inscription)! (See also update 5)
Stretch goal unlocked!!!
Timeframe
After the end of the campaign and receiving the funds (3 weeks) I will place the order for the GPIO cards. Normally they should arrive after 3-4 weeks. Than I have to pack and prepare for shipment. So 8-10 weeks after the end of the campaign the boards should be on the way to you by Swiss Post. In most parts of the world they should arrive after ??? weeks... Normally! At the moment it can take up to 3 months :-( This is the reason why I set the delivery date to November...  But without guarantee ;-)! If it is not possible to ship to your country due to restrictions I will contact you directly to discuss the best solution for you (wait or refund).
If you need more boards please contact me with your needs ;-)
And if you want to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram... I would be very glad!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The design is ready, the first prototypes delivered. At the moment the biggest risk is the global situation with lockdowns and reduced transport capacities...
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I know a little bit later than planned, but sometimes things work out differently than expected...
After finally the right envelopes were delivered, a customer realised that a project that was originally planned for spring has to be carried out this year... (after postponing to autumn, cancellation, postponing to next year, now immediately, but to implement it in only 6 weeks and not in 3 months, "you don't know when the next lockdown will come...") Welcome to the real existing global C... Madness!

updates.update_userinfo: Short Update: Cards arrived/preparing for shipping
updates.update_content:
Ok, 1 week later than expected but they arrived... ("Shipment exception: Delay beyond our control" What ever this was...)
This means I will lock the surveys and orders in the next days. If you need to change your address or the color selection please do it in the next 3 days. I will start packing at the end of the week. This time it is a bit more complex (colors and additional orders). So I will probably need 2-3 weeks. The next challenge after this will be shipping... When I last checked 2 weeks before it was possible to nearly all countries (just 2 where I found no way from Switzerland, Austria or Germany...) Since this changes almost daily, I will check it again shortly before printing the labels and sending. But in general it looks good :-)

As mentioned the announcement of the winners of Update #3!
Actually, it was meant to be that everyone who shared the campaign in his social network and sends me the link were added to the list... Since this were only 2 in total, and one of them also dropped out, I had to think of something else ;-)
Congratulations to Backer

I just wanted to inform you that the GPIO Cards were ordered! They should arrive in the week of 21.09.
43 backers have not filled out their survey yet... It would be nice if you could do it within the next days ;-) If you did not receive the mail from PledgeBox please send me a short mail, so I can resend the survey. If your pledge was not successful at Kickstarter you have the chance to do the whole thing via PledgeBox… (2 dropped backers on KS were successful!)

There were some confusion whether the GPIO Card Extended V2 card comes with or without notch... 
All "regular" cards come with notch!
If you don't want to buy other cards you only have to select the colors.
The prototypes come as described with or without notch.

So, now all pledges should have been collected by Kickstarter. This time many backers were dropped because the pledges could not be collected... 10 backers, worth CHF 395 and 64 cards :-( A pity and a little bit annoying but never mind...
All surveys will be sent soon and you should receive the emails in the next 24 hours. If not see information below!
You can/must choose the color for every single card - for the backers with the 25 card pledges, sorry ;-)

Wow, what a campaign!
More than three times what I hoped for at the beginning of this adventure... It is every time fascinating to see how a project is spreading the world :-) This time with the nice add on experience of a stretch goal and a last minute design change...
Thank you to all 384 backers in 34 countries!

As some of you know my favorite is the RPi Zero W - for many reasons - and not the bigger ones...  But I don’t want to start a „political“ discussion ;-) (the main reasons - for me - are battery powered mobile off-grid use and the size)
For a new project I need a Pi with more power and I remembered that a RPi 3B+ is laying unused in a box. Found the Pi and connected the GPIO card... Holy sh... It’s not working when you use the middle holes! About 3.2 mm to wide and colliding with the Cam connector!

updates.update_userinfo: Evaluation of the poll and the consequences...
updates.update_content:
...for me after 128 responses. But it confirmed what I suspected.
more than half want the possibility to choose the colour
2/3 of you wish to have the possibility to split
about 2/3 (split) or 3/4 (general) would prefer the black version
it should be possible to add more cards
the option to purchase other products should also be available

campaign.story:
Space Command! An epic sci-fi adventure series.
PLAY

Get Your Star Trek Crate Now!
 Exclusive!  New Space Command T-Shirt! 
Available only here! Wear your Space Command Backer Status With Pride!
Space Command is a hopeful vision of the future, a science fiction TV series starring legends of sci-fi and the silver screen such as Doug  Jones, Nichelle Nichols, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Armin Shimerman, Barbara Bain, Christina Moses, J.G. Hertzler, James Hong, Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Harney, Ethan McDowell, John Hennigan, Faran Tahir and many more big names to be announced soon!
This epic series covers 180 years in the lives of four families, and is written, directed and produced by Marc Scott Zicree, who  has writing credits on dozens of shows over the past 40 years -- Star  Trek: The Next Generation, Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5,  Sliders, The Real Ghostbusters, Smurfs, He-Man, as well as the bestselling Magic  Time trilogy of novels, Guillermo del Toro’s Cabinet of Curiosities and the Twilight Zone Companion.
Season One Consists of an Audio Play Prequel plus Fourteen Filmed One-Hour Episodes split into two-hour stories that form a larger arc. So far, the first six episodes have been shot – with the seventh episode currently in pre-production!
 The First Four Space Command Episodes Are Finished – And Can Be Yours Now! 
These include:
UNITED PLANET – The Space Command Prequel Audio Play, starring Doug Jones, Michael Harney, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Ethan McDowell, Bruce Boxleitner, Bryan McClure, Aungelique Scott, Nathaniel Freeman andVictor Manso.
REDEMPTION, Part One – The Space Command Pilot, starring Doug Jones, Michael Harney, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Ethan McDowell, Bruce Boxleitner, Bryan McClure, Nathaniel Freeman and Victor Manso. Available as an HD download.
RIPPLE EFFECT, Part One – Shot entirely during the Covid-19 Pandemic, our stars shot their own scenes in their own homes with their own cameras! Stars include Neil deGrasse Tyson, Nichelle Nichols, Doug Jones, Michael Harney, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Ethan McDowell, Bryan McClure, Aungelique Scott, Nathaniel Freeman and Victor Manso.
RIPPLE EFFECT, Part Two – As above, shot by the actors in Los Angeles, upstate New York, Northern California, Atlanta, Portugal and Saskatchewan!
In addition, REDEMPTION PART TWO has been shot and will have its 900-plus visual effects shots completed in the next few months!
Beyond this, the next episode, FORGIVENESS PART ONE has been shot and is in post-production, with our studio prepping FORGIVENESS PART TWO to be filmed in the next few months!
Space Command Forgiveness part 2
Space Command Forgiveness Part 2  is  the seventh episode in this epic science fiction adventure  series. This campaign is to help fund its forthcoming shoot at our Space Command Studios.
Space Command Forgiveness, parts 1&2 movie poster
These are some of the science fiction icons that support Space Command
Recognize any of these names?
Space command stars many,  many science fiction legends, past and present! We've still got a few  more BIG casting announcements coming! When we cast more actors, we'll  be adding them below!
Big Trouble in Little China
WWE Wrestling, GLOW
Star Trek, Iron Man
ALSO IN THE SPACE COMMAND SERIES
Babylon 5, Lost
The Shape of Water, Star Trek: Discovery, Pan's Labyrinth, Falling Skies
Total Recall, Star Trek: Voyager, Stargate
Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5, Lost in Space
Babylon 5, Tron
Orange is the New Black
Doom Patrol, The Gifted, Space Command
Star Trek: The Origianl Series
COSMOS
A Million Little Things
Star Trek Deep Space 9, Buffy the Vampire Slayer
Space 1999, Mission Impossible
Star Trek: Deep Space 9, Voyager, Enterprise
Additional stars
Space Command also has a group of incredible up-and-coming Hollywood actors in starring and supporting roles. Here they are:
Ethan McDowell, Sara Maraffino, Nathaniel Freeman, Victor Manso
Dallas Malloy, Bryan McClure, Barbara Lee Bragg, Ryan T. Husk
Coley Speaks, Elle Sonnet, Justin Sorvillo, Jelena Mrdja
Marc & Elaine Zicree have written and  produced hundreds of hours of series TV, pilots and feature films for  most of the major studios and networks, including Paramount, Universal,  Disney, Sony/Columbia Tri-Star, MGM, Warners, Castle Rock, New Line,  CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox, WB, UPN, Showtime, PBS, Turner, USA Networks, Syfy,  Discovery, Nickelodeon, the BBC, Marvel, Scholastic, ITV and NPR. Among  their credits are classic episodes of Star Trek – The Next Generation,  Sliders, Babylon 5, Deep Space Nine, Friday the 13th – The Series,  Smurfs, Superfriends, He-Man, Captain Power and the Soldiers of the  Future, The Littles, Forever Knight, Liberty’s Kids and The Real  Ghostbusters, among many others.
Marc and Elaine’s work has been nominated for the Hugo Award,  American Book Award, Humanitas Prize, Nebula Award and Diane Thomas  Award, and has won the prestigious Hamptons Prize, TV Guide Award, Rondo  and Saturn Awards. In 2014, Marc was named a Writers Guild Diversity  Honoree.
Marc and Elaine Zicree, co-directing on the set of Space Command.
A word from creator, Marc Zicree:
"As a kid I loved STAR TREK, TWILIGHT ZONE,  OUTER LIMITS, FORBIDDEN PLANET and grew up to write for such great  shows as STAR TREK – THE NEXT GENERATION, DEEP SPACE NINE, BABYLON 5,  SLIDERS and more.
I often hear fans say, “Why are there so  few good sci-fi shows on TV, and why do so many go south?” I can tell  you – frankly, most of the network suits just don’t get it.
But you and I do.
So when I recently got the idea of creating  a new show inspired by the sense of wonder and possibility science  fiction gave me as a kid, I realized I didn’t need a network or studio  to make my dream come true -- just Kickstarter and you.
Thanks for making it happen."
Where are we now?
This is the progress of the Space Command epic series. Episodes are coupled, into two-parters. For example, episodes one and two are coupled, three and four are coupled, etc.. Each episode is one hour, divided into two 30-minute chapters.
EPISODE 1 - SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION PART 1
completed, and released!
EPISODE 2 - SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION PART 2
principal photography completed
postproduction is funded and nearly complete!
EPISODE 3 - SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS PART 1
principal photography completed
postproduction, editing, VFX, are being completed
EPISODE 4 - SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS PART 2
principal photography scheduled
our goal is to fund production of this chapter
EPISODE 5 - SPACE COMMAND: THE GREAT SOLAR WAR PART 1
coming soon...
Movie poster for episodes 5&6, "Great Solar War" parts 1 and 2.
HERE ARE SOME OF THE REWARDS AVAILABLE IN THIS CAMPAIGN!
Space Command Captain's Wristwatch
SAMPLE PAGES OF THE STAR TREK/SCIENCE FICTION SCRAPBOOKS FROM 1966-1969
Dozens and dozens of pieces of 50 year old history. These are a real blast from the past!
Notice the date? January 12th, 1968. This is only one third of the letter that is included.
An image of what one of what the original scrapbooks look like. The above are scans.
SAMPLES OF RARE TWILIGHT ZONE MEMORABILIA
Actual film
You remember this legendary episode
COMIC BOOK COVER ART
Concept art by our incredibly talented set designer, Erick Rodrigues.
Concept art by our incredibly talented set designer, Erick Rodrigues.
Concept design
Faran Tahir
James Hong
John Hennigan
We cannot do this without you. You can support us  financially, or just by helping us spread the word. Here are additional  ways you can help:
Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or any social media
Emailing the campaign to your friends
Follow us on social media and keep the positivity going on our pages
But rest assured, every dollar secured will go to completing Space Command!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Raising funds via crowd funding is very difficult. But we are confident in our product and confident in the support of the fantastic fans of the science fiction community. Together, we can make this series come to life!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

These are collections of Star Trek/sci-fi pictures, handwritten letters, autographs, newspaper clippings, and magazines articles from 1966-1969!! All of these images were collected by Marc Zicree 50 years ago and kept safe in these scrapbooks since then. Every page of these two scrap books will be scanned and sent to you along with a note about it all from Mr. Zicree.
You'll also receive a digital VIDEO of Marc going through the Scrapbooks and sharing memories with Nichelle Nichols on the set of Space Command.
We'll also send you a digital STAR TREK TIME CAPSULE which includes a bundle of videos, papers, etc.. from yesteryear.
Lastly, you will also get a "THANKS" CREDIT in the end credits of Forgiveness Part Two as well as on IMDb!
(If you don't have an IMDb page, we'll make one for you!)
INCLUDES:
Ultimate Star Trek Digital Bundle

support.title: ART OF MARC ZICREE BOOK!
support.descp:
All of the previous digital perks plus:
Before he was a professional writer, Marc Zicree was an accomplished visual artist,
with his work exhibited in major galleries and national magazines. Now for the first time, The Art of Marc Zicree presents his artwork from age five to twenty-two, including never-before-published drawings, paintings, sculptures and photographs of spaceships, aliens, superheroes and more, with Zicree's portraits of such iconic figures as Frankenstein's Monster, Flash Gordon and Ming the Merciless, Ron Cobb, Harlan Ellison, the Phantom of the Opera, Charles Laughton's Dr. Moreau, Cabal from H.G. Wells' Things to Come, Obiwan Kenobi and more! Downloadable PDF book, with downloadable video of Zicree discussing each image.

updates.update_content:
We are pushing forward everyday with more and more visual effects shots completed and we can now say that Redemption Part 2 should be finished and ready to send out by Christmas of this year! That means if you ordered a digital download, a DVD or Bluray, or anything involving Redemption Part 2, we'll be delivering those by Christmas 2021. 
If you haven't had a chance to order a DVD or Bluray yet, you're in luck! We recently sent an email with info on new DVD and Bluray perks that are now available in our current campaign. Here's a video about it:

Hello and thank you again to all of you who contributed to the Space Command Kickstarter campaign.
Here is an accounting of all the perks we have delivered for campaign 1
CAMPAIGN 6

campaign.story:
The Respolab mask has been co-developed by a group of industry leading companies to ensure it's performance is as good as it can be. The focus has been on simplicity and quality to create a product that is easily manufactured and cost effective for the end user. It's fair to say we have exceeded all expectations. 
PLAY

The Respolab mask offers an advanced solution that is far more capable than other masks on the market. If you are wearing a mask for any period of time you are really going to notice the difference 
The graphic above shows the inadequacies of some more common mask types, especially those with valves that allow the spread of viruses from asymptomatic users.
We have already undertaken significant real world testing to ensure the upmost comfort and practicality of product. 
Stretch Goal 
If we are able to hit an ambitious target of £90,000 of funding from our awesome customers we will make an exciting range of colors available to you. We will reach out to you if we manage to achieve this goal and take your requests. We are working on some additional customization too and will look forward to sharing more details of these in due course. 
The Respolab mask is available in a range of sizes. The mask has a soft sealing component, called an oronasal, This creates a comfortable seal to the face but it is important that the correct size is selected. A simple way to check this is to measure from the bridge of the nose to the understand of the chin, as shown in the graphic below. Needless to say, if the wrong size is selected we can replace your mask with the correct fit. 
We are offering a range of reward packages all with 3 replaceable filter cartridges. Your product will be delivered in a box with a carry bag to keep you mask clean when its not being worn.
We have now introduced an option to purchase 10 filters with every mask ordered. These additional purchase options will be available on the perks list for you to select. Selecting this perk will automatically replace for original pledge. 
Respolab is also making available large batch orders at extra competitive prices. This can be purchased for yourself or offered as a charitable donation. Just let us know where you would like them sent. 
Over the last 10 weeks the team at Respolab have worked tirelessly to bring to market a face mask that sits between the low cost disposable face masks and heavy duty respirators. We have developed a patented filter system capable of capturing nano particles and blocking virus transmission. It’s manufactured entirely in the UK to preempt potential supply chain issues and comes as a full face or half face solution. All at a price point below the cheapest disposable masks. 
Our project has been on track right from the start and we now have product in for certification with BSI, an independent test house in the UK. They will certify that our product is safe and conforms to the relevant standards before we start production of the required tooling. This process will take no more 14 days, at which point we can start producing the mask which will come out to you. We look forward to sharing video updates of the certification process.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are at an advanced stage in the design process and are now investing in production tooling to validate our design. This has to be done prior to certification as in order to achieve CE conformity to EN1827 our mask must be made using production techniques. This is a costly process, so the impact of failing the testing is high. We may experience delays if we don't get certified first time. That said, we have done lots of simulation and have budget to re tool elements of the mask if required.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Respolab's mask features an exchangeable filter. The body of the mask can be deconstructed and washed when the filter cartridge is being replaced. The cartridges themselves can be returned for recycling and at the end of life the mask can easily be deconstructed to its constituent parts and recycled.
Reusability and recyclability
Our customers will be advised on how to recycle each part of the face mask. We have used common materials where possible. These can be easily separated and recycled with usual household waste.

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
As a significant portion of orders have now been dispatched, we would like to provide a detailed update on the latest developments of the engineered face mask campaign, which you kindly pledged to support last year. As I am sure many of you are aware, the path to creating a new business, product and market is not an easy one to tread with many speedbumps along the way. The saying goes, 1 in 10 (90%) of start-ups fail within the first year.

Non-CE fulfilment / CE fulfilment 

We are now nearing the completion of fulfilment for the non-CE pledges. We are still on track to have all fulfilment of non-CE pledges to be completed by week commencing 31st May.

To re-iterate from the last update, should you wish to check the status of your order you will need to log into your BackerKit account. Once shipped, you will receive an email from Transglobal (our freight forwarders) to confirm that your order is on its way and the Air Waybill number for tracking purposes.

Fulfilment / Order Status / BackerKit / Full Face

We have been continuing to fulfil Non-CE orders to backers who have opted in to receive them. We are happy to report that we have now dispatched 62% of these Non-CE pledges. We anticipate having the remainder dispatched prior to 31 May.

Fulfilment Notifications / Small Masks / Feedback

We are happy to share that we have continued to fulfil non-CE certified (half face mask) orders at a steady pace this week.

Backers should receive 3 separate notifications by email:

Fulfilment / Stock Availability Small / CE Certification / Full Face Masks / Refunds
We have been working steadily through fulfilment of orders this week and have sent approx. 200 out of approx. 800 non-CE pledges. We are working through dispatching orders as quickly as we can! Once your order has been dispatched you will receive a notification from BackerKit. You will get an additional notification once we have uploaded the tracking codes onto BackerKit.

The update you have all been patiently waiting for… We are now shipping non-CE pledges!
Images of colour options:

Dispatch of Non CE Pledges / E-Store

Good Evening Backers, 

Following on from our last update reporting the unfortunate hold up of some small but essential components we are glad to update you that the parts have since been delivered. Production continues and the dispatch timelines still stand as per below:

Weekly Update
Delivery Schedule
Even though in this current situation it has felt like an upward struggle we have pushed on and pursued our vision. Social distancing, quarantining, UK border closures and self-isolation have had a profound impact on our production lead times, freight timelines and CE certification testing schedules.

Tooling and production / Full face masks / CE survey
It has been another positive and productive week and we have good news to share. The tooling for all major components of the half face masks is complete and our UK based suppliers are working flat out to manufacture the quantities we require to fulfil all your pledges.
The Respo team have been (socially distanced, and of course wearing masks) on site with UK manufacturers overseeing quality control and ensuring the rate of production is maintained to meet our dispatch at the end of this month. This initial dispatch will be non – CE certified pledges (excluding full-face masks) for those who requested to receive them.

Hi Backers,
As a few of you have pointed out, the email address in the latest update included a typo.
The correct email contact is: info@respolab.com
Kind regards,

campaign.story:
♻ BREATHE V2 ♻
Introduction
♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ is the ONLY Re-usable Exhalation Valve with a built-in BRASS filter for respirator masks on the market.
What is an exhalation valve?  It's a one-way valve that allows exhaled air to escape through a clear pathway.  Without such a valve, moisture begins to build up inside a mask leading to increased heat, humidity, discomfort, and mask deterioration.  Adding a valve will also extend the usage of disposable N95 masks resulting in cost savings and decreased environmental impact due to less waste.
Printed in Canada with a mirror-like finish with FDM PLA
How does ♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ improve upon the traditional exhalation valve design?  A seamless removal and re-attachment feature!  This allows it to be re-used indefinitely across many masks (that do not already have a valve).  Traditional N95 masks with built-in exhalation valves do not have an easy means of removal without compromising the valve itself.  They are either sewn into the fabric, glued between fabric layers, or clipped very tightly such that removal may cause cracking/shattering of the valve.
Retrofitted to a 3M N95 Mask
Retrofitted to a McCORDICK N95 Mask
Seamless attachment and removal
♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ saves money over time as users can purchase cheaper non-valve equipped masks, retrofit it, and use it for longer (like a traditional valve-equipped mask).  Users can stop throwing away masks after a few hours of usage and start saving money with the valve installed instead.
Masks last longer with a valve which means less waste and more cost savings!
One of the biggest pieces of feedback we got from our first version is the lack of a filtration system during exhalation.  We've improved this by introducing a brass screen filter inserted into the valve.  The brass screen filter acts as a moisture droplet deterrent by catching saliva from exhaled breath.
The rear of the valve (facing towards the wearer)
Close-up of the brass mesh filter
Here are some government sponsored resesarch articles that discuss the usage of copper/brass and its anti-microbial properties:
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3067274/
https://www.nejm.org/doi/10.1056/NEJMc2004973
Any obstacle between the wearer and the outside acts as an additional deterrent for moisture droplets.  While the brass screen filter does not filter microscopic particles, it is a first line defense against small moisture droplets (which is the main infection vector).  The valve cover is the last line of defense, by reducing the exhaled air area down significantly.  Note that both of these facilities will greatly reduce but not eliminate the risk as there is no filter that currently exists that can filter all microscopic particles WHILE providing exhalation relief (its an inverse relationship).
How is it attached or removed?
The user simply cuts a circular hole 3.5cm x 3.5cm on their mask and then rotate-clips on the ♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ valve.  The valve clips on as tight as any valve-equipped mask.  Now you have a respirator mask with an exhalation valve!
Attaching the valve
For removal, the user just needs to rotate the valve clockwise and remove both pieces. 
Removing the valve
It can fit most mask thicknesses ranging from 0.1 - 1.5mm.
Can it be cleaned?
Yes, otherwise it wouldn't be re-usable!  A quick rinse in iso-propyl alcohol, or soap and water (with subsequent drying) is enough for it to be re-attached to a new mask!
Washable for re-use!
Expenses
The primary expenses for this project are:
3D PLA printing filament spools
TPE Gasket material
Brass mesh filters
Shipping costs
Packing supplies
Keeping it simple
These will be manufactured in-house using our 3D printing fleet.  There will be no overseas sourcing and no packaging to keep things fast and simple (other than the mailer that it is shipped in).  Single ♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ valves will be shipped in small envelopes with individual plastic zip bags while larger quantity ♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ valves will be shipped in either larger padded envelopes or boxes.
We have priced each ♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ valve at $10 CAD (about $7.25 USD at current exchange rates) with the following shipping costs:
$3 CAD for Canadian orders
$4 CAD for US orders
$5 CAD for International orders
Some bundling discounts apply for shipping when purchasing multiple valves.  Kickstarter backers receive a large exclusive shipping discount as opposed to orders directly from our website.
All valves are dipped in iso-propyl alcohol prior to packaging to sterilize and clean them.  Though it's recommended that users clean them again just in case.
So, who are you?
My name is Stephen Co and I am a computer engineer by day and a kinetic artist by night.  I've crowdfunded 2 unique Kickstarter campaigns in the past (first one delivered and a recent second one in manufacturing stages).
My previous campaigns can be found below:
Aquarius Fountain Lamp
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/northerncircuitsinc/aquarius-a-water-manipulating-fountain-lamp
String of Pisces
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/northerncircuitsinc/pisces-kinetic-art-lamp/
My team consists of myself, my wife, and my 2 year old son :)
Outreach
As my resources are limited, I will not be performing any marketing spend outside of traditional word-of-mouth and social media postings.  This is where YOU come into play.  Regardless if you choose to back or not, a simple share of the campaign on any online outlet is greatly appreciated and will help spread the word.  It only takes a few seconds of your time.
What about your existing project Pisces?
There will be NO impact to the Pisces Kinetic Lamp project.  That project is currently delayed due to logistics supply and manufacturing from China (due to the COVID-19 situation).  I will be piggy-backing my 3D printers to print the valves alongside the Pisces parts.  In addition, as we Canadians are all effectively under self-isolation and social distancing rules, I have additional hands-on deck with family members and friends to assist with packing and logistics.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I do not expect any major risk or challenge assuming a modest backer rate.

There is a chance that postal offices and/or logistics routes become closed off. In such a situation, there will be delays in delivery or even complete holds at shipping warehouses until further notice.

As demonstrated in my previous campaign, I delivered all rewards on time and will do so for this one too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The design is made of PLA and will only be subject to light physical forces in normal usage resulting in a long-lasting design. It will essentially last a life-time (or more) with normal usage.
Reusability and recyclability
There will be no additional packaging with the device to reduce waste and cost (shipped in a single protected envelope or bubble mailer). The design itself was made with re-usability in mind.
Sustainable materials
The design will be manufactured in-house using PLA, a corn-starch based plastic material which is bio-degradable with 0 environmental impact.
Sustainable Distribution
There is no additional packaging other than the envelope that it is shipped in which will reduce waste.

updates.update_content:
Hi folks!
Valves have now been shipped out.  US backers should expect to receive it within 1-2 weeks, Canadian backers within 1-3 weeks, and international backers within 2-4 weeks.
These are shipping from Canada so Canadian backers might be wondering why it would take longer.  Reason is that Canada Post has delays across all their services and has ceased delivery guarantees.  For international backers, its a bit of a mixed bag currently.  Depending on the recipient country, they may or may not have delayed postal services (ie. Switzerland has major delays, but Australia and Italy do not).

Hi folks,
Just a quick note that I've recently switched to a slightly thicker TPE gasket material.  The thicker material is more durable, has slightly more tension against inhalation/exhalation, and won't warp as easily.  It's also a bit more expensive compared to the previous material but I purchased it in bulk for use in other projects so overall it will be an upgrade to the valves :)  You will see the differentiation in the gasket material as the color will be gray instead of black.  Just thought I'd mention this in case folks ask why the color of the gasket is different from the pictures when they receive it.

project_data.project_name: ♻ BREATHE V2 ♻ | N95 Exhalation Valve now with Brass Filter!

campaign.story:
LATEST UPDATES
 Project Background
The Maker’s Field Guide has been written as the first and only resource of its kind — demystifying almost every single tool, technology, and process involved in the making, building, or manufacturing of professional quality prototypes for use in design, engineering, product development, special effects, and crowdfunded / Kickstarter projects. Written by acclaimed industrial designer Christopher Armstrong, this book is the by-product of over a decade of practical, hands-on experience honed directly in the field of advanced research & development. Relying on the latest scientific methods in STEM and cutting edge R&D (Research and Development) practices from around the world, it delivers a comprehensive understanding on the use of manual  "old-school" tools of the trade, as well as "new-school" state-of-the-art technologies; featuring real-world case studies by top industry professionals in all areas of design, engineering, and filmmaking today. 
After launching in late 2018, the book was met with critical acclaim within the industrial design industry, ranking as the #1 Industrial Design book and Top Design Books of All Time by BookAuthority, and was featured in Iron & Air, Urban Workshop, and The Entrepreneur Motivation Podcast.
Now for 2020, we need your help get this momentous book printed as a hardcover! Not only will this hardcover book have a beautifully updated black & gold foil cover design, it will also include 80 new pages of content as an updated & expanded GOLD edition. This is an absolutely essential resource for anyone wanting to achieve professional quality prototype results, with content that's accessible for everyone from beginner all the way to advanced / professional industry-level. 
 What is the Maker Movement?
The Maker Movement represents a dramatic shift towards the democratization of design, engineering,  education, jobs and manufacturing. Advancements in new technologies such as desktop 3d printing and CNC machining are now putting powerful tools that were once only available to large institutions like NASA in the hands of millions of creators worldwide. This rapid pace of disruption is creating a paradigm shift and playing-field leveler like no other in history, opening up many new opportunities for independent makers and entrepreneurs that were once thought to be unimaginable. As a result, this is leading to what's known as the small-batch or "lean manufacturing" revolution giving rise to the "maker" and maker culture — the repercussions of which are so monumental, in fact, that it's often been compared to the countercultural revolution that pervaded the West in the 1960's.
Put simply — the Maker Movement is a collective group of empowered individuals who are becoming much less dependent on large manufacturers for the production of their goods and services. Add to that an increasing level of interest and investment into corporate R&D (Research and Development) programs that are leveraging the use of new technologies as a way of gaining a competitive advantage in the marketplace. All of these combined factors have placed an emphasis on STEM and engineering educations or skill-sets as the path forward to success in this new era of uncertainty and globalization — with tens of thousands grade-schools worldwide now rushing to build their own Makerspace facilities (now becoming hot commodities) out of both a fear of missing out, and in an attempt to stay out in front of this lighting-fast pace of change in today's volatile jobs marketplace. 
This movement is also responsible for placing less emphasis on formal degrees, and more focus on practical problem-solving capabilities — that can be demonstrated through real life, project-based portfolios instead (or simply put, provability of results as evidenced by real-life examples and / or case studies; no complicated math formulae or academic theory needed). If you've seen Kickstarter (or similar crowdfunding platform) campaigns raise millions, or tens of millions of dollars on a relatively simple, scratch-built functional prototype alone — you've witnessed the full power of the Maker Movement firsthand.

 Updated & Expanded GOLD Edition Sneak Peek
 NEW 80+ pages of expanded content (290 pages in total), including content suited for those serious about pursuing a successful career in R&D (research and development) or who are looking to profit from a prototype to launch on Kickstarter. No stone has been left unturned, giving each individual maker or Startup entrepreneur the best chances of success and is easily comparable to tens of thousands of dollars worth of higher education costs in such industrial design, engineering, product development and model making fields:
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded Table of Contents
Chapter 02 - Machines (1st ed. paperback content)
Chapter 03 - Hand Tools (1st ed. paperback content)

Chapter 04 - Materials (1st ed. paperback content)
Chapter 05 - Application (1st ed. paperback content)

 Expanded Advanced Projects section, showing step-by-step behind the scenes process of professional project case studies.
 Expanded R&D industry & jobs section, giving a holistic overview on how multidisciplinary teams function to bring successful products to market.
 NEW Index section added, along with a NEW expanded glossary of critical R&D industry terminology.
 NEW added section on mass manufacturing, which peels back the hood on how to bring a conceptual prototype design or invention to market. 
 NEW color coded chapter section tabs and pro tips highlight boxes, to facilitate much easier reference & indexing:
 Expanded and massively updated 3d printing/additive manufacturing section, now featuring 30 new pages covering metal 3d printing, rubber polymers, HP Multijet Fusion, Polyjet and many others. This now makes The Maker's Field Guide the most comprehensive, exhaustively researched resource covering almost all of the different types of on 3d printing / additive manufacturing anywhere on the planet:
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content
NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content

NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content

NEW 2020 GOLD expanded content
 NEW beautiful black/gold foil hardcover format (11" x 8.5"), for lasting durability & shelf life (just like a quality watch you'd want to pass on down to your grandkids!): 
 Current Project Status 
Where we are currently at: we've already negotiated pricing and delivery terms with our book printing factory. Because we are also the publisher on this title, we can assure that both quality and delivery will be accelerated, as we have eliminated the need to go through an intermediary to produce, market, and secure distribution of the book on our behalf. 
The book is complete and ready to go to production once funds are released from Kickstarter. In order to publish the book, we need to get at least 300 collective book pledges or the equivalent funds from other backer levels.
Once the campaign ends and our factory has the order, the books will take approximately 9 weeks from initial production until delivery. Shipping accounts for 5 weeks of that time.
 Use of Funds
By backing this campaign, you will help to give us the resources needed to finance an initial production large enough to meet our manufacturer's minimum requirement. The goal of funding is to finance an initial production run of printed hardcover books, which will be distributed directly through www.themakersfieldguide.com and also through Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and other major book retailers. An order must be placed that's a large enough satisfy the offset printer’s requirements in order to set up the large metal plates (dyes) used in the offset printing process — which is industry-standard for full color photography books like this one. Once the books have been printed, they will be shipped to our regional location in Southern California, where they will be made available for sale throughout the USA and Canada, with possible plans of international distribution in the future depending on the level of demand from other territories outside of North America. 
The higher the amount of total funding received also equates to a much larger printing quantity available for distribution, where the educational impact of the book will have the ability to spread across a much larger surface area both domestically and abroad.  
Stretch Goals: 
 **Please see Updates #11/#12 & updates at top of project page. Made in the USA production will be possible above $32,000 in funding. USA production will also shorten the overall production and shipping timelines, allowing backer deliveries to be processed much faster (by at least 2-4 weeks). 

Timing 
Make no mistake — while the timing of this Kickstarter campaign is a little "unique" given the COVID-19 situation worldwide, the hardcover edition of this book has been a a plan of mine even before the outbreak. Because over 10 million workers have been displaced in the USA alone, this is a time for people who may be struggling to find a source of income. Therefore, the Maker Movement represents is one possible solution of empowering a new wave of entrepreneurs and independent creators to rise up, weather the storm, and to produce new products, innovations or solutions to important problems — in ways that have never been seen before (which, society will be the ultimate beneficiary of). 
Optimistically, more than a few groups of open-sourced, decentralized maker communities have made headlines recently, by showcasing to the world their ability to quickly and adaptively contribute innovative solutions to the recent PPE shortages experienced by hospitals. The implications of this type of cross-collaboration on a design & manufacturing front reach far beyond the current situation we are facing. See this fantastic editorial by the NY Times:  Coronavirus is Straining Hospitals. Here's How Innovators Are Helping. | NYT News. 
Billionaire Shark Tank investor Mark Cuban is one of the voices of optimism, and has even publicly stated recently that the next 10, 15, or 25 companies that go on to change the world will be starting during these challenging times. In his mind, and in the minds of many other prominent business & investing thought leaders, it is the spirit of entrepreneurial problem solving, innovation, and a dogged persistence that remain the fundamental economic drivers of a nation like America — and will all be key factors in our ability to come out of this pandemic stronger than ever. And, because of the quarantine measures being implemented in many locations, what better opportunity than ever to spend this time reading and learning something new!
 About Christopher
Christopher Armstrong is an acclaimed industrial designer and product developer, having held senior leadership positions on multiple Advanced R&D / Special Projects teams. His work has been featured in Hypebeast, Digital Trends, Footwear News, TransWorld Motocross (TWMX), Red Bulletin Magazine, AOPA Pilot, Coroflot, RECOIL, Performance BMW, Octane, ImagineFX, and others.
After studying at The Art Center College of Design, he has since spent nearly a decade in the design industry working with over 30+ clients worldwide — everything from small business Startups to Fortune 500 companies — including the NFL, EVS Sports, LIFT Aviation, Hazard 4, Stanley Black & Decker, Sony Playstation, Hot Wheels, O'Neill, Gridiron Labs, Microsoft Xbox, Piloti, and others. He has lectured and given workshops at multiple art and design schools, including Art Center, Concept Design Academy, Red Engine School of Design, and Brainstorm.
He was born and raised in Houston, Texas and currently lives in Southern California. Check out his professional design work at www.behance.net/christopherarmstrong
Featured On
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The paperback has already been in print for well over a year without issue, and the expanded manuscript for the hardcover book is almost complete and ready to go to production once funds are released from Kickstarter — with only final proofreading, proofing, and QC (quality control) needed. All pricing and timeline needs have been thoroughly negotiated with and approved by our printing manufacturer, for both USA and international production.

That said, final timeline and backer deliveries may be slightly effected due to the current COVID-19 situation worldwide. Our manufacturer continues to remain fully operational (both domestically and internationally), and we have made our best estimates regarding the timing of fulfillment and shipping. USPS is running slower than usual, and it is possible that circumstances beyond our control could potentially effect and/or delay our production and shipping dates. Currently, the 9 week production + shipping timeline accounts for up to a few thousand units. However, if this blows way past these expectations (a welcomed problem), we will make all efforts to produce the orders in batched quantities, then mail them out as they are completed. We will make every effort to keep backers informed along at all steps along the way if any problems/delays were to arise.

In order to publish the book, we need to get at least 300 collective book pledges or the equivalent funds from other backer levels. Please note that there are a handful of countries that we are not able to ship to: Ascension; Bolivia; Falkland Islands; Republic of North Korea; and Somalia. Stay safe!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: FINAL UPDATE — All Orders Delivered + NEW Kickstarter Drop Coming in Q2/2021!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,
I've been meaning to get this final project update out since the beginning of the new year. 
There have been quite a few questions coming in, so here's a brief bulleted list that should answer most of your FAQ's I've been receiving over the last few weeks:
 All pledges have been fulfilled, with just a few international shipments being delayed due to regional tariffs or customs issues. Importation procedures/speeds vary from country to country. For instance, there were about five different backers who had not received their shipments in the Netherlands. In some cases, packages have taken over after Asendia (the 3rd party tracking aggregator assigned to most packages by my fulfillment partner) shows they arrived in-country or were marked as 'delivered.' Unfortunately, Asendia does not provide real-time updates like a first party shipper would. If you still have not received your package, my suggestion is to follow up with your local shipping authorities directly. You can do this by contacting the largest regional shipper in your select country and see if they can track it down. For everyone who sent messages about potentially lost items, all replacement copies have already been issued and you should be receiving those soon.

Backers, 
Just a very quick update to keep all of you informed. This will be one of the last and final updates before all orders have officially been fulfilled.
 All USA orders have already shipped. The USA shipments that have still not gone out are because either A) Backers did not answer post-campaign survey w/address information, or B) Backers pledged for tier labeled *International and therefore were mis-categorized. That said, we're working on getting the last and final books in in the mail by Tuesday Nov. 3rd (election day) of this week.

Backers, 
A few of you have been asking for an order update, so here it goes: ~900-1,000 USA backers' orders have already shipped this past week. Once mailed out, you will receive a tracking # (via PayPal in the USA, via KS direct message international). 
Because we have to go through a different shipping supplier (shipping aggregator) for international shipments to achieve the low S/H price transporting across waters, this requires an additional step, is much more complex on our end, and requires us to batch the orders separately. This is why USA orders have  been given priority over international backer orders. Good news is that all USA orders have been shipped, with the exception of a small percentage of backers who have not completed the address information requested in the post-campaign backer survey (50+ addresses have not been provided in total).

This week we started final assembly on 3,000 hardcover books. Shipping to you is on schedule to start next week, with most orders set to go out by month's end at the latest.
Here's a few shots from our Illinois, USA production line.

Hey All!
Just a quick update to show what the production cover will look like.  "Spot gloss" has been added to the tools, title text, and gold graphic areas (this is what the magenta overlay sheet was used to verify in the previous updates). This cover is made using the exact same process that will be used in the production books, which have already been printed and are undergoing final assembly. For demonstration purposes, I've wrapped the sample cover over one of the hard proof "book block" (or interior pages) provided by the factory. All that's needed now is for this flat printed cover sheet to be wrapped around a stiff backer board, which will eventually be bound to the rest of the book in the final assembly. There's nothing better than seeing the fruits of tedious product development work finally coming together — I'm quite happy with the results so far, and can't wait to send the final books out to all of you once they arrive in the next coming weeks! :)

Backers,
Hope you all are doing well. Chris here with a quick update — I've just received official word from our USA factory that the full print run of hardcover books is slated for a completion date of 9/15 or 9/16. 
Five additional days will be needed to bulk freight the stacked palettes from the factory to our physical HQ location (SoCal), where they will then be sorted, signed (select orders), packed and shipped out to backers immediately after. Therefore, expect the books to start going out in the mail somewhere around

project_data.project_name: The Maker's Field Guide: Expanded GOLD Edition Hardcover

campaign.story:
As a Chemistry teacher, I always think that it is a good idea to engrave the Periodic Table on a card.
This is a high-quality electroplated black SUS304 stainless steel card, engraved with the full Periodic Table of elements and some useful scientific data. It is manufactured by a reliable Taiwanese company, which has 15 years of experience of metal card production, as well as very advanced laser engraving techniques.
A Full Periodic Table is Engraved
The Periodic Table of the Elements is probably the most significant piece of information in Chemistry. The table on the card includes all 118 elements with the most updated symbols and relative atomic masses.
The most updated information is gathered. For example, the revised relative atomic mass of Hafnium (from 178.49 to 178.486) has been taken into account (Source: https://iupac.org/standard-atomic-weight-of-hafnium-revised/).
A Data Chart and a Unit Conversion Table are Engraved
At the back, there is a chart listing some common constants, with a unit conversion table below.
Remarkable Quality
Tons of time had been spent on the design process to create a perfect card.
The SUS304 stainless steel card is extremely durable and corrosion-resistant. The metallic lustre of the card gives you an ultra-luxurious feel. All information is laser engraved (but not printed) on the card, meaning that all words, symbols and numbers will not fade nor wear off.
Thickness is enhanced to 0.6 mm (normally 0.3 mm for most metal cards) to ensure high rigidity.
Challenging Manufacturing Process
The Periodic Table and data tables are very complicated, so it is very difficult and time-consuming to engrave them on a stainless steel card accurately and precisely. 
But with our experienced manufacturer in Taiwan, all problems have been solved. The final product is awesome. All words and numbers are very clear.
The Card is Pocket-Sized
Dimensions of the card: 85.5 mm x 54 mm (same as a credit card). It can be easily fitted into your wallet!
Made in Taiwan
A local Taiwanese factory is chosen to produce the Chemistry Card. The production cost is pretty high, but the quality is excellent.
A Handmade Card Sleeve is Included (Exclusively for Backers!)
A handmade card sleeve will be included for each backer purchasing the card.
The sleeve is handmade by a local artist in Hong Kong. It is free for backers who buy a card now. After the campaign, it will be sold at HK$35 separately with the card.
Discounted Price and Free Worldwide Shipping for Backers
A discounted price (HK$145 / card) is offered to all backers, with FREE worldwide delivery and a handmade card sleeve included. More discounted prices will be offered for larger orders. All cards and sleeves will be shipped via registered mail.
Future retail price will be HK$160 / card + shipping cost, excluding the card sleeve (retail price: HK$35).
This is a great chance for you to obtain an awesome card and a stunning handmade card sleeve, at a very discounted price.
Shipped in an "Envirolope"
Your cards and sleeves will be shipped in a padded envelope called the "Envirolope", which is much more expensive than a traditional packaging bag, but is plastic-free and advocating sustainable forests.
Details and Specifications of the Card
Dimensions: 85.5 mm x 54 mm (with rounded corners)
Thickness: 0.6 mm ± 0.03 mm
Material: stainless steel (SUS304)
Colour of the card: black
Colour of the engraved information: silvery
Place of origin: Taiwan
Details and Specifications of the Card Sleeve
Number of card slot: one
Colour: grey
Exterior: cotton fabric
Interior: synthetic fibre
Place of origin: Hong Kong
  A Few Points to Note...
In the Periodic Table, only the symbol, atomic number and relative atomic mass of each element are engraved. The element names are not included because there is not enough space. Besides, while I have tried my best to search for the most updated data, science is changing every day so the information on your card may not be valid forever...
I expect that the cards can be delivered to all backers by August 2020. Thank you very much!
Why Kickstarter?
Indeed, we have already produced some cards, as you may see in our photos. However, as we have only made a handful of them, their unit cost is very high. If we can raise a certain amount of fund, we can afford to produce the cards in bulk. As a result, the costs for material and manufacturing will be much lower, so we can sell the cards at a much more reasonable price. Therefore, we need your support!
Please follow us!
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/minuteobjects
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/minuteobjects
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/minuteobjects
Website: https://www.minuteobjects.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are numerous difficulties during the design and manufacturing process, but all of them have been solved. It is challenging to draw a small but clear Periodic Table, gather the most updated information, find the best manufacturer that can solve all technical problems... However, all issues have been perfectly overcome.

The only risk will be shipping. All orders will be sent from Hong Kong. Although the post offices here are still operating, registered airmail services are partly suspended due to the coronavirus, so it may take a longer time for your cards to arrive (depending on your location).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Ultra-high quality SUS304 stainless steel is chosen as the material of the cards. This material is very durable and corrosion-resistant. Also, all information is laser-engraved (but not printed), meaning that all words, symbols and numbers will not fade nor wear off.
Reusability and recyclability
Your cards and sleeves will be shipped in a padded "Envirolope", which is much more expensive than a traditional packaging bag, but is plastic-free and advocating sustainable forests.
Sustainable materials
The card is made of stainless steel, which is obviously recyclable.
Environmentally friendly factories
The metal cards are made in Taiwan and the card sleeves are handmade in Hong Kong. The project aims to support small local workshops and studios. No sweatshop nor polluting factory is involved during the manufacturing processes.

updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Again, thank you very much for your support.
We are very glad that many of you love the Chemistry Card. Some backers have told us that the engravings on our metal cards may be too small for them to read. After reviewing all your suggestions, we decided to offer a credit card-sized magnifier as an accessory.

updates.update_userinfo: New Metal Card Available Now - The Unit Conversion Card
updates.update_content:
Hello all,
Again, thank you very much for your support!
We would like to introduce our new metal card - the Unit Conversion Card: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/minuteobjects/the-unit-conversion-card

Hi all,
Hope you all safe and sound. Thank you very much again for your support and sorry again for the delay. In this post, we would like to share the latest information about the reward delivery.
As far as we know, 95% of packages have already been delivered. Sorry that we realize some backers in several countries have not yet received their rewards, including Italy, Belgium, Denmark, Norway, and part of the US. We are tightly following up with the post office and the packages should come very soon.

Hi all,
Hope you all safe and healthy. Very sorry about the delay in delivery. We would like to share some information with all of you.
According to what we observe, about 80% of backers have already received the cards and card sleeves. The remaining 20% are mainly in the US, France, Denmark and Norway. We are following up and they should come very soon.

Hi all,
Sorry again for the delay. Indeed, we just got the latest update from the post office.
In July and August, airmails from Hong Kong to most countries were suspended, so we could only ship out most packets via sea by surface mail. We now have the most updated information from the Hong Kong Post Office.

updates.update_userinfo: A Quick Update about the Shipping Delay
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Finally, we have time to write some updates.
We have already sent out 96% of the rewards last month. If your rewards have been shipped, you should have received a message containing a tracking code. For the remaining 4% which have not been shipped, we will explain this in a moment.
Sorry that we are currently unable to send things to a few countries, including Russia, Brazil, Kuwait, Iceland, Chile, Jamaica and Saudi Arabia, as mail services to these countries are temporarily suspended. We will send the rewards to backers there once the services resume and meanwhile look into other possible shipping methods.

Dear backers,
Here are some updates of the campaign:
We are indeed working around the clock to prepare the shipments. All cards are ready now and we are trying our best to deliver them as quick as possible.
The only problem now is the delay in shipping. Due to the recent coronavirus outbreak in Hong Kong, post offices here only provide limited services so we cannot post your rewards efficiently. Even worse, mail processing centres in Hong Kong and many other countries are seriously jammed with parcels. Therefore, sorry that there may be a delay in delivery of your rewards.

updates.update_userinfo: We are shipping the rewards to backers!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
Thank you so much again for your support! We would like to post a quick update to show you our progress. Indeed, we are starting to ship out the cards and card sleeves.

Hi all,
Just want to give you some updates about our project.
We are trying our best to prepare your rewards as quick as possible, as we understand that most of you are excited.
We are launching another crowdfunding campaign for the cards on Indiegogo (campaign link: https://igg.me/at/the-chemistry-card). Same rewards and same prices are offered. If your friends want to pre-order the cards at a discounted price but had missed our previous Kickstarter campaign, they may consider backing us on Indiegogo. However, their rewards will be delivered much later (probably by December 2020) because we have to prepare all the rewards for Kickstarter backers first.

updates.update_userinfo: We have sent a survey to all backers!
updates.update_content:
Dear all backers,
Thank you so much again for supporting our project! Because of you, the cards can be brought to live.
As you may have already noticed, we have sent a survey to all backers, asking about your delivery address and the number of card sleeves that you would like to receive. Please kindly complete the survey so that we can send the rewards to you.

campaign.story:
Nexus, a novel
We are raising funds to publish a science fiction novel based on the popular Nexus comic book. I created Nexus with Steve Rude in 1981.
Nexus, the Cosmic Avenger, faces Gourmando, a vast, alien entity that consumes civilizations. Its herald Gnosis swoops the cosmos on a silver board seeding worlds to make them edible. While Gourmando threatens Nexus' home planet Ylum, Nexus is on Earth executing mass murderers. This is his job. Torn between his duties and the survival of his planet, Nexus must reach deep within himself to save Ylum. The novel is loosely based on a storyline I worked out with Steve Rude, which will be published next year by Dark Horse. The novel is different from the graphic novel, and covers Ylum and its colorful cast of characters in much greater depth. Years ago, Rude asked me what Nexus story I would most like to pursue. Nexus versus Galactus, I said. Marvel owns Galactus, so we created our own planet-devouring monster.
I am a two-time Eisner and Inkpot winner, creator of Nexus and Badger. I have written Punisher, Flash, and Star Wars. Ten years ago I began writing novels. Kevin J. Anderson, NYT best-selling science fiction author, has published four of my novels, including Whack Job, Helmet Head, Banshees, and Skorpio.
"Mike Baron's NEXUS may be one of the finest examples of galaxy-spanning worldbuilding in Science Fiction. Add to that a compelling cast of characters, a flawless ear for dialogue, and a genuinely thrilling story, and the result is a truly brilliant book, full stop." – James A. Owen, bestselling author of HERE, THERE BE DRAGONS
“Comic fans have long loved Nexus, and now Mike Baron's Nexus novel brings his award-winning superhero to life in ways we haven't seen before. Witty, profound, and deeply moving, this novel is serious science fiction.”—Kevin J. Anderson, New York Times bestselling coauthor of Dune: House Atreides
