updates.update_content:
To our friends who backed the Nexus Novel: Thank you! We are encouraged! We will write another!  Ended at $16,665 with 394 Backers. 
Mike and Ann

Thank you to everyone. Now over $15,000.  
Mike and Ann Baron

Wow!  Now, we are over $14,000. Again, we are very thankful to each one of you.
Mike and Ann Baron

Again, thank you and we are grateful. Over the $13,000 mark and we stillhave over 2 weeks remaining.  
Mike and Ann Baron

We thank everyone and we hit the $12,000 mark on funding.  Wow. Now every backer will be emailed the first two chapters of the Nexus 2 book. Greatly appreciated. 
Mike and Ann Baron

Hi Everyone, 
We have hit over $10,000.  Wow. Greatly appreciate every one of you. 
The next Stretch goal is when we hit $12,000 then every Backer receives by email the first two chapter of the Nexus 2 novel.  Mike will write it and this will only be exclusively available by email to the Backers of this Kickstarter.

Hi Everyone, 
Thank you so much and we hit the $8,000 goal.  This means that every backer will be emailed the short story "Come to Papa." This is a short story which has never been published. Here is a little blurb on that short story:  "Come To Papa" is a science fiction story about an aerospace engineer working on a satellite. A lab explosion drives a fragment of the unique
metal into Carl Spaulding's skull. Carl's in the hospital for a month. Rather than acknowledge their failure and liability, Spaulding Aerospace fires Carl on trumped up charges of negligence and intellectual theft.
Carl never had a chance. Neither Carl nor Spaulding understand the implications of that metal fragment inside Carl's skull. Not until the day he returns to work with a gun."

We met our goal within less than 24 hours of launching the Kickstarter. We appreciate every one of you and we are so grateful.  
Once the Stretch Goal is met at the goal of $8,000 then every back will be emailed the short story "Come to Papa." It is not related to Nexus but a great short story which has never been published. 
Again, thank you to each backer.

campaign.story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT
This will be our 10th sketchbook.  We skipped the past 5 years due to a death in the family and our son, Brandon, spent over a year in and out of the hospital.  We're finally back and creating a sketchbook to span the missing 5 years.
To keep costs down and still bring in the high quality, we are starting with a page count of 128 pages.  For each $5,000 raised over our goal we will add 8 pages so the final page count is up to our supporters!
AFFORDABLE QUALITY
Anyone who has ever ordered from us knows we care about the quality.  This is not a "kinkos" handmade sketchbook.  All our books (and everything we do) is top quality, professionally printed, thick stock, archival safe and we spend thousands on sturdy shipping containers, mailers, tubes, and packing to get those items to you safely.  If something arrives damaged we will replace it on request.  Back us and support quality and high standards.  We also don't want to overprice anything.  Sure, we could price basic levels at $100, but we like to keep things affordable.
GET IN EARLY, SAVE MORE
In an effort to minimize cost we are rewarding our earliest backers with "at cost" pricing.  We don't scrimp on quality or packaging so you are paying for thicker stock, professionally printed items and sturdy packing to get your items to you safely.
 CURRENT CHALLENGES
 $40,000 for the Challenge Coin which is currently being designed.  
1,000 Backers - We will include a set of 10 5x7 postcards plus a large sticker FOR THE FIRST 1,000 BACKERS ONLY.  Steve will draw 10 sketches on a postcard that looks like the blank cover and they will randomly go out in postcard sets
EXTRA BIRTHDAY BONUS
We were asked to include the Nexus Family Portrait in a goal that's reachable!
SO....Everyone who backed by 11:59pm PST May 19th will receive a Nexus Family Portrait bonus print!  If you upgrade to 11x17 or poster print then your Nexus Family will also be that size.  If you missed out you will have an option to order 
NOTE: This will be included the sketchbook only levels (not digital).  
WHAT'S INCLUDED SO FAR...
 PRICE GOES UP WEEKLY!
MAY 8-10: FIRST RESPONDER LEVELS: First responders get the most amazing deal as a thanks for being the first to help us reach our goal!  These levels get in AT COST as our way of saying thanks to our biggest supporters!
MAY 11-17: CHALLENGE ACCEPTED LEVELS: You have accepted the challenge to help get to the challenge coin; our highest stretch goal.  
MAY 18-24: DEFENDER LEVELS: Everyone needs a superhero. Thanks for having our backs!  We appreciate every level and are showing it by keeping costs down!
MAY 25-31: NEVER TOO LATE LEVEL: We’re in the last week now and it’s not to late to get in on these amazing backer only packages!
We've designed several packages to suit every budget with lots of flexibility and the ability to order whatever quantity you want!  Basic packages are:
NO FRILLS: You'll receive a PDF of the Sketchbook with the Wonder Woman cover PLUS a PDF of the Spidey Book if we reach $30,000.
SKETCHBOOK ONLY: You'll receive the PDF of the book plus a mailed copy of the sketchbook with all the extra pages added as stretch goals, a bookmark, plus the Spidey Book if we get to $30k.  Customize your package to add on books or prints.  ADD $5 TO HAVE STEVE SIGN YOUR BOOKS 
SKETCHBOOK + EXTRAS: Everything from above PLUS print #1 and your choice T-Shirt design, plus the extras outlined in the stretch goals. ADD $5 TO HAVE STEVE SIGN YOUR BOOKS
ARTIST PACKAGE: ALL THREE COVERS (2015-20 Sketchbook PLUS the alternate AND blank covers) PLUS a PDF PLUS Steve’s Nexus Chronicles hardcover, PLUS everything signed AND T-Shirt PLUS all other extras!
SKETCH PACKAGE: ALL THREE COVERS (2015-20 Sketchbook PLUS the alternate AND blank covers) PLUS a PDF PLUS Steve’s Nexus Chronicles hardcover, PLUS everything signed AND T-Shirt PLUS all other extras!  PLUS Steve will draw a sketch for you on your blank cover!  Package comes with a black and white marker sketch.  Add $200 for color, or $500 for something really special!  LIMITED TO 10 (DISCLAIMER: STEVE HAS THE RIGHT TO REFUSE A CHARACTER SO PLEASE  CONTACT US FIRST IF YOUR CHOICE IS NOT FROM NEXUS OR A KIRBY CHARACTER).
I WANT IT ALL:  If you've missed past years and want the best price at catching up then this is the package for you.  You'll receive ALL THREE COVERS (2015-20 Sketchbook PLUS the alternate AND blank covers) PLUS a PDF PLUS Steve’s Nexus Chronicles hardcover, PLUS everything signed AND T-Shirt PLUS all other extras! plus a PDF of all past year books AND mailed copies of the in stock books. 
 SPIDEY BOOK IS A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!
2015-20 SKETCHBOOK & COVERS
This year we will have 3 covers.  The main cover (Wonder Woman), Alternative Cover (Batman) and a Blank Cover.  We plan to print around 500 of the main cover and only enough alternative and blank covers to fulfill orders.
INTERIOR PAGES
We currently have a 126 page book that was compiled in 2015.  As mentioned earlier, to keep costs down we will start with this page count add 8 pages for every $5,000 raised over our $10,000 goal.  We would love to produce a 250 page book!  
Here is a sample of some of the already compiled pages going into this years' book.  Something for everyone - commission sketches, fine art projects, and pages from Steve's sketchbook!
COMMISSION SKETCHES
PAINTED WORKS
INSTRUCTIONAL PAGES
PAGES FROM HIS PERSONAL SKETCHBOOK
EXTRAS
Extras are the best part of the fundraiser.  For funding the sketchbook the first extra is a bookmark (with all mailed levels), + Print #1 and a T-Shirt (levels with extras).
Our most popular image, the NEXUS FACE T is 1 of the 2 options for shirts.
2 SHIRTS - 4 OPTIONS EACH - NO EXTRA CHARGE FOR LARGER SIZES
STRETCH GOAL ITEMS
 KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE EXTRA BOOKLET
SPIDEY BOOKLET IS A KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE!
UPGRADING/ORDERING EXTRA
Thanks to BackerKit, upgrading and ordering extras is easy!  Each level has their own checkout and each item is given a value.  To upgrade you simply pay the difference (i.e., short sleeve is $20 and long sleeve is $30 - if you choose long sleeve during checkout you will be billed an extra $10.  If you choose short sleeve no payment is requested, we simply ask for your shipping information.)  Add extra funds to your pledge now and use them during checkout!
For more information, click on image to see in at www.SteveRude.com
 +$200 for quick "Artist Choice" sketch in Chronicles Book
CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON THEINDIVIDUAL SKETCHBOOKS
DON'T FORGET TO FORWARD, TWEET AND LIKE!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Biggest challenge is trying to keep International Shipping down. Even though we charge up to $60 for the larger packages those could easily cost us $100 to ship. 

Having so many books under our belt and with the book already nearly completed we are excited to fulfill the final product!

We are still sourcing printers for reasonable turn around times. With COVID-19 many printers are 10-12 weeks out so we pushed our fulfillment date out to September. We are attempting to source everything in the USA with materials made in the USA. 

This is our 10th book and fulfillment via BackerKit makes tracking upgrades and special requests a breeze.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Our 2021 Sketchbook is currently in review by Kickstarter, but here is an exclusive sneak peek at offers.  Kickstarter has approved the project and we will launch at noon, PST on Saturday, April 3rd, just 2 days!
LINK TO PROJECT: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/steverude/2021-steve-rude-the-dude-sketchbook?ref=4ojmj1&token=3a8b439c
NOTE: We are still adding all the reward levels and add ons so that's not finished yet!  We are also pulling artwork that is available for sale that was used in the book and will be adding those as extra add ons.

Thank you all for your support of the 2020 Sketchbook.  As we finally send off Nexus: Gourmando to the printers, we are also preparing the 2021 sketchbook and plan to launch it over the next few weeks.
We are trying to simplify our Kickstarter goals in order to both streamline the process and take out any confusion.
To best meet needs we would like to ask you to quickly reply to the below survey which should only take a few minutes.

If you missed the Gourmando Kickstarter, we have just launched a 2nd campaign at IndieGoGo.  Quantities are limited as the book is currently at the printer and the print run is set.
The TPB is being finalized Monday and should be in house by May.  The hardcover has been expanded to 320 pages and enlarged to 12x15" making it over double the typical "Artist Edition" size, but it's going to be gorgeous!   Prices are slightly higher than the Kickstarter run with limited options, but we are offering FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING on the Deluxe and Limited Edition sets.

I'm pleased to report that the missing Batman cover books have made their way over the border and should be in house by Saturday so we are hoping to get off all the remaining orders by Monday!  The orders are boxes up and just waiting for the Batman book to be added.
We have a few left that did not have Batman books that we are working to get out tomorrow.  Brandon's trip to the hospital for 2 days threw off my entire schedule (and sleep) so I'm just now feeling human again and back to work.

INTERNATIONAL ORDERS
I'm getting ready to ship out another round of international orders on Friday after the Thanksgiving holiday.  I'm just doing the customs forms now.  All the Canadian orders should be done unless you had a Batman book.
BATMAN BOOK UPDATE

updates.update_userinfo: Steve Rude Livestreaming to End off Gourmando Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
With about 30 minutes left we are $2,000 short of adding over 20 pages to the trade paperback version of Nexus: The Coming of Gourmando.  Steve is livestreaming - See one of the blank covers in progress.  This one a Superman color!
https://www.facebook.com/steverudethedude/videos/822373465180830/

We are down to about 250 US orders.  Steve just finished the last of his May Free Comic Book Day commissions and is moving onto getting those black covers finished and I'll be posting them here as they're finished!  He plans to do a few via LiveStream as well.
So far we've had to reorder shipping supplies twice (it's impossible to guess the size of the boxes with each order customized) and batching in groups of 30 orders at a time seems to be working great with zero errors so far.  The post office has destroyed a few packages which we have replaced at no charge (they're all insured!), but 99% of packages are arriving unharmed and perfect.

YAHOO!  Books are in house!  We are going to start shipping tomorrow.  We will send out shipping notifications the day before your item actually ships to give you time to make changes, so please watch for your confirmation. 

We are starting with the orders that had posters as those are forced through because we had to ship the prints.  The next group we've singled out is the one that only has the books.

campaign.story:
"I have waited 43 years to see Cerebus No.1 the way it was supposed to look. Thanks to Sean Michael Robinson and The Waverly Press that wait is now over." 
- Dave Sim, 2020 
Every legend has a beginning…
In December 1977, Deni Loubert published Cerebus No.1, Dave Sim's comic book that followed the adventures of a short-tempered, barbarian Aardvark. Originally conceived as a parody of Barry Windsor-Smith's masterfully illustrated Conan the Barbarian (which was a big hit for Marvel Comics in the 1970's), Sim quickly found his own voice as a storyteller and illustrator, abandoning the typical self-contained, single issue adventures in favor of elaborate story-arcs which would often span dozens of issues.  
Dave Sim at the Forest Heights College Comic Book Convention in Kitchener, Ontario, about a year before Cerebus No. 1 was published. Photo by Max Southall.
The dawn of the 1980's saw the popularity of Dave Sim's Cerebus explode, igniting a revolution among self-motivated artists and storytellers who were looking for ways to go it alone, outside of the corporate structure of the BIG TWO publishers at the time, Marvel and DC Comics. Dave Sim helped pave the way for countless other self-publishers of the day, including Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Bob Burden's Flaming Carrot, Jeff Smith's Bone, and Colleen Doran's A Distant Soil, to name a few... Along the way, Cerebus found its place as one of the most intelligently written, entertaining, and influential comic books of all time! Though the series ended in 2004 with issue No. 300 after more than 6,000 pages of story and art, Cerebus still enjoys an intense and loyal following to this day.  
Due to popularity of Cerebus, original copies of the first issue now command thousands of dollars, putting them out of reach for most collectors. 
The original Cerebus No.1 was printed on newsprint paper and after 43 years, most of the few examples that have survived are typically found in lower grades. This new edition is presented with fully remastered art, prepared by master digital restoration artist Sean Michael Robinson, and will be printed on premium paper for stunning crystal clarity! We are working with one of the best printers in North America to ensure the highest quality reproduction!
RED - 24 Page Standard Edition. The original 24 page comic as it was presented in 1977, with remastered art. It's like owning an original Cerebus No. 1, only cooler!
GOLD - 48 Page Expanded Edition. The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! Limited to the number of advance orders we receive.
PLATINUM - 48 Page Expanded Edition (Signed & Numbered). The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! Each PLATINUM copy is hand Signed & Numbered by Cerebus creator Dave Sim! Limited to the number of advance orders we receive. NOTE: Aardvark-Vanaheim "Cerebus Archive" patrons can specify their unique Cerebus Archive number for the Signed & Numbered platinum edition. 
PROOF EDITIONS - These are proof copies produced for final internal review by Dave Sim, Sean Michael Robinson and the Publisher. These final stage pre-production proofs that we are offering represent the culmination of all the work that went into developing the "Expanded Cerebus" No. 1. This is our way of sharing the experience of the final stage of production with Cerebus readers who will receive the exact same copies we will be reviewing before the book goes to press. 
RED (proof) - 24 Page standard Edition (50 Numbered Copies). The original 24 page story with remastered art, just like the original book as it was published in 1977, only better! NOTE: These 50 examples are the only 24 page "Standard Edition" remastered copies that will ever be offered with the original $1 cover price. The final production books will come with a $10 retail cover price! 
RED (proof) - 48 Page Expanded Edition (50 Numbered Copies). The original 24 page story with remastered art + 24 pages of Cerebus Archive rarities! NOTE: These 50 examples are the only 48 page "Expanded Edition" copies that will ever be offered with RED flames! 
 If you are already a collector of Cerebus, this edition will rank with the crown jewels of your collection. If you are new to Cerebus, this is the perfect way to get introduced to this classic series, from the moment where it all began... 
 MANY sincere thanks to everyone who has supported or will be supporting this project in it’s final week. We put our heads together with Dave Sim to offer all of you a wide range of exciting Cerebus No. 1 collectibles!
Everything below is available to all backers who pledged for the $10 physical book and up... The price of the first item includes any additional packing and shipping costs, with discounts on the 2nd item and up... Perhaps you own a comic shop, or you like to hoard for a rainy day, for those of you we are offering bundles of 10 of everything at a deep discount.
To add any of these items to your existing pledge, simply click the "manage your pledge" button at the top of this page and manually add the additional amount (on top of your existing pledge amount) based on the prices below. When you fill out your backer report at the end of the campaign, be sure to note what extras you added to your pledge.
You are free to add as many as you want of each item (unless noted otherwise). NOTE: The “Stretch Goal” items, Pins, and Posters are being produced exclusively for this Cerebus No. 1 project, based on the number of orders received. None of these items will be widely distributed or reprinted.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We completed all of our work ahead of time and have proofed everything in advance. Our primary challenge is the COVID-19 virus which has the potential to slow down or delay manufacturing and delivery chains. As of the launch our printer and postal service remain open and we expect to remain on schedule but will send out regular updates during production. We have listed a much longer shipping window just in case there are printing and shipping disruptions. However, we plan to go to print in June and get all orders shipped in July so long as everything remains open. NOTE: Orders shipping outside of the United States may see extended shipping delays. In the event that postal delivery services are temporarily halted in any country, we will hold your package until normal shipping resumes. Every person who pledges will receive their package!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

During the development of the remastered Cerebus No. 1 the publisher had samples printed to review the evolution of the project. In all, there are 4 different editions, each one much more developed than the last. Only a handful of each were printed for internal review by Dave Sim, Sean Michael Robinson, and the Publisher. Since they have been handled they are not in pristine condition, but they are ultra-rare and ultra-cool! Additionally, we will include some other sample material that was prototyped for this project! On top of it all, you will get a 30 minute phone call with Cerebus creator Dave Sim where you are free to discuss anything you like!

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just a quick note to let you all know that the Cerebus No. 1books are nearly finished and we expect them to arrive in less than 2 weeks!
Also, if you haven't seen it yet "You Don't Know Jack" is on it's last day on Kickstarter. It's a project Dave Sim worked on and looks like a cool book! They have a some great packages available as they enter the home stretch. Check it out and back them if you can!

campaign.story:
For years, fans have been clamoring for David Sherman's TO HELL AND REGROUP, the epic conclusion to his original series The 18TH Race. This book has been long delayed due to health concerns and issues with the past publisher of the series. After long last, and thanks to the help of author Keith R.A. DeCandido, we bring you the final installment of this hard-core military science fiction novel where humanity fights for its very existence. (For those new to the series, books 1 and 2, ISSUE IN DOUBT and IN ALL DIRECTIONS, are available through the add-on section or via specific pledge reward levels.)
In addition, we also present a brand-new series by veteran Star-Trek author Christopher L. Bennett. ARACHNE'S CRIME--the first book in a planned duology set in in a universe of the author's original creation--sets out to explore deep space and ends up in a harrowing encounter with new races, in a twisted tale of blame and redemption where responsibility and motives are not as clear as they may seem.
Won't you help us make these books a reality?
The primary goal for this campaign will fund the production of both books and the fulfillment of pledge rewards. The authors receive an equal share of 50% of the profits raised thereafter, with 50% invested in the press to meet promotional and operational needs.
If science fiction isn't your thing, you can still help support us. You can choose the IMPARTIAL OBSERVER reward level and pledge a sufficient amount to claim the book or books you would like from our Add-Ons section below. There are plenty of fantasy and steampunk titles available, even a little bit of horror, if you're into zombies! If no...perhaps you could help us out by spreading the word! Thank you.

David Sherman is the author or co-author of some three dozen books, most of which are about Marines in combat. He has written about US Marines in Vietnam (the Night Fighters series and three other novels), and the DemonTechseries about Marines in a fantasy world. The 18th Race trilogy is military science fiction.
Other than military, he wrote a non-conventional vampire novel, The Hunt, and a mystery, Dead Man's Chest. He has also released a collection of short fiction and non-fiction from early in his writing career, Sherman's Shorts; the Beginnings.
With Dan Cragg he wrote the popular Starfist series and its spin-off series, Starfist: Force Recon—all about Marines in the Twenty-fifth Century.; and a Star Wars novel, Jedi Trial. His books have been translated into Czech, Polish, German, and Japanese.
After going to war as a U.S. Marine infantryman, and spending decades writing about young men at war, he's burnt out on the subject and has finally come home. Today he's writing short fiction, mostly steampunk, and farcical fantastic Westerns.
He lives in sunny South Florida, where he doesn't have to worry about hypothermia or snow-shoveling-induced heart attacks. He invites readers to visit his website, novelier.com.
Keith R.A. DeCandido is a writer and editor of more than three decades' standing (though he usually does them sitting down). He is the author of more than 50 novels, more than 100 short stories, around 75 comic books, and more nonfiction than he is really willing to count. Included in those credits is fiction in the worlds of Star Trek, Alien, Farscape, Doctor Who, Andromeda, BattleTech, and many other science fiction milieus, as well as in universes of his own creation (such as the "Precinct" series of fantasy police procedurals, also published by the fine folks at eSpec).As an editor, he has worked with dozens of authors, among them Mike W. Barr, Alfred Bester, Margaret Wander Bonanno, Adam-Troy Castro, Peter David, Diane Duane, Harlan Ellison, Tony Isabella, Stan Lee, Tanith Lee, David Mack, David Michelinie, Andre Norton, Robert Silverberg, Dean Wesley Smith, S.P. Somtow, Harry Turtledove, Chelsea Quinn Yarbro, and Roger Zelazny. Having edited David Sherman's first two 18th Race books, Issue in Doubt and In All Directions, he is honored to assist him in finishing the trilogy by coauthoring To Hell and Regroup with him. Keith is also a martial artist (he got his third-degree black belt in karate in 2017), a musician (currently with the parody band Boogie Knights), and a baseball fan (having avidly followed the New York Yankees since 1976). Find out less about Keith as his cheerfully retro web site at DeCandido.net.
Christopher L. Bennett is a lifelong resident of Cincinnati, Ohio, with a B.S. in Physics and a B.A. in History from the University of Cincinnati. A fan of science and science fiction since age five, he has spent the past two decades selling original short fiction to magazines such as Analog Science Fiction and Fact (home of his "Hub" series of comedy adventures), BuzzyMag, and Galaxy's Edge. Since 2003, he has been one of Pocket Books' most prolific and popular authors of Star Trek tie-in fiction, including the epic Next Generation prequel The Buried Age, the Enterprise -- Rise of the Federation series, and the Original Series prequel The Captain's Oath. He has also written two Marvel Comics novels, X-Men: Watchers on the Walls and Spider-Man: Drowned in Thunder. His original novel Only Superhuman, perhaps the first hard science fiction superhero novel, was voted Library Journal's SF/Fantasy Debut of the Month for October 2012. He has three collections reprinting his original short fiction, Among the Wild Cybers: Tales Beyond the Superhuman from eSpec Books (containing an original Only Superhuman prequel novelette) and Hub Space: Tales from the Greater Galaxy and Crimes of the Hub from Mystique Press.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of the books proposed in this campaign have already begun production. Baring situations outside of our control, the only risk is in schedule delays. However, we will always keep you updated.

updates.update_content: So, all but two of the physical rewards have shipped or will ship on Monday, as the books I was waiting for arrived early. For those two that are not shipping, it is because you have not filled out your survey so I have no idea where to send the books. I have emailed the two individuals privately. Here's hoping they receive the emails. I don't want to say names in the update, but I will say that the two individuals in question, one of them this was the first Kickstarter campaign they backed. The other person, this was the second campaign they backed.

Wow, the holidays really do make difference. I received notification yesterday that both Arachne's Exile and The Arachne Omnibus have shipped!
Now...as is my luck, they printed in California...but I am expected to have them by Monday. I work Monday and Tuesday, but first thing on Wednesday, the final rewards will be shipping out! I am so excited to be able to say that. Thank you for your patience. I know we haven't hit our deadline yet, but I really do try to fill these as quickly as possible after the campaign and desperately want you to have your books. Soon! So soon! (Well...borked postal service aside...)

So I have never had this happen before...I received three printer's proofs in one day.
Now, you might be asking what that means for you...
Books! Both Arachne's Exile and The Arachne Omnibus have been ordered. Once I receive the stock I can start sending out the last of the rewards. The only thing outstanding at this point are DemonTech: The Last Campaigns (formerly Get Her Back!) and Jeff Young's science fiction collection. Both are awaiting covers, and the collection is still in editing, but as no one took physical rewards for either of those, the print portion of this campaign is done! The links to the ebooks will be distributed to those waiting once they are available.

Just wanted to let you know that I just ordered the copies of Arachne's Exile for the campaign. I expect they will take a week or two to get here.
I am waiting for the printer's proof for the Arachne Omnibus, then those will be ordered as well.
Best,

Hi Everyone!
The Happiest and Healthiest of New Years to you all.
I am delighted to say that we pulled off a miracle. The Arachne Omnibus went to press a mere half-hour before midnight. Here is the cover:

Hello, everyone!
Happiest of New Years to each and every one of you.
It has taken longer than I would like, but we have managed in the final hours of the year to wrap up another project. Arachne's Exile has been completed and uploaded to the print. Those awaiting the ebook version should have received a link to the digital files. If you miss the email, check the inbox on your Kickstarter account for the link.

Hello, everyone.
While I hope to have more news before the holidays hit, I am erring on the cautious side. I hope you and yours have a safe, healthy, and happy holiday!
Now...I wanted to share with you this pretty picture:

I wasn't expecting it this soon, but I am very thankful to say that we are going to print on Arachne's Crime. I am also thankful for all of you, both your support and the faith you show in us. You make it possible for us to do what we love.
Speaking of which, here is the finished cover!

Happy Thanksgiving, everyone.
Things I am thankful for, my family, my health, and the support and faith you place in us.
I am delighted to say we are very close to uploading Christopher L. Bennett's Arachne's Crime to the printer.
We are still working on the text treatment for the cover, but in the meantime, I wanted to share the cover art:

Hi everyone,
Hope you are doing well and have some room to breath after all the political excitement this week.
We are making strides on the covers for Christopher L. Bennett's Arachne novels. The cover is straight-forward, but requires some new programs to complete, which involves a learning curve. The primary figure that will be on the cover is nearly done and the artist will be playing with placement and filters next. Everything he is doing for the first cover will carry over to the second, so those should complete fairly quickly one after the other, including the Omnibus cover.

campaign.story:
WonderSense is the world-leading consumer sensor node, which including such features as tiny form factor, low-cost high-performance TDK InvenSence 9-axis IMU sensor, maximum 300Hz wireless sampling rate, original high-performance data processing algorithm, and easy to use API for the developers.  
With the provided data collection smartphone App, in no time, you can mount or wear the WonderSense on the limbs, trunk, or head,  collect and visualize the motion data, or storage the data into the database server for later analysis. 
WonderSenseは９軸センサーを搭載したウェアラブルモーショントラッカーです。
BLEを搭載しているためスマートフォンやPCと接続してリアルタイムに人やロボットなどの動きを記録することができます。また、Android端末では最大300Hzでのリアルタイムデータ送信が可能です。
Tiny Form-Factor to Fit with Any Applications
The size is like a wristwatch, and the weight is within 10grams including a 180mAh Li-Po rechargeable battery.
本体は腕時計ほどのサイズ、10グラム以下の重さでバッテリーを搭載しているため、腕や足など付ける場所を選びません。
Out of Box Application for Data Collection and Visualization
We provide a basic function application for WonderSense, you can use it without developing new applications easily and immediately.

基本的な機能を持ったアプリケーションが提供されるため、独自にアプリケーションの開発をしなくても簡単にすぐ使用することができます。

 SDK for Multiple Platforms 
We provide open-source SDK for WonderSense basic functions, you can focus on developing your applications. 
SDK supports iOS / Android / C# at the moment, it will support other platforms in the future.
https://github.com/wonder-wonder
このWonderSense用のオープンソースのSDKが提供されるため、自分のアプリケーション開発や実験に集中することができます。
また対応プラットフォームは現時点ではiOS/Android/C#に対応しており、今後更に追加されていくため、幅広い開発環境で使用できます。
Basic Function
You can connect it to a smartphone in just a few steps, and you can check collected data in Real-time.
接続にはほとんど時間がかかりません。また取得したデータを瞬時に確認することができます。 
Processing Sensor Data 
The orientation of the sensor in the absolute coordinate system is estimated at the same time as the data is collected.
データ収集と同時にセンサーの絶対座標系での向きが推定されます。
Some Demo Applications
Tracking of Motion Trajectory
Estimate the speed, direction, and translation based on the collected acceleration and angular data. 
搭載されている加速度とジャイロデータをもとに、移動した方向と量を推定することも可能です。また、推定したデータを利用して軌跡を描画することもできます。
Human Behavior Real-time Recognization
 You can use collected data for real-time data recognition using a classification algorithm. 
事前に教師データを取得しておけば、分類アルゴリズムを利用することでリアルタイム行動認識をすることも可能です。
 Real-time Activity Recognition 
Game Controller 
You can use hand gestures to interact with game characters intuitively. For example, you can create applications that operate in VR games without a controller.
ゲームキャラクターを手のジェスチャーで直感的に操作するようなことも可能です。例えば、VRゲーム内でコントローラを使わずに操作するようなアプリケーションも作ることができます。  
WonderWonder team started from CNLab at the University of Aizu. We focus on developing a motion-capture platform to bridge the gaps between the ideas and the innovations. In the past twelve years, we have successfully developed some novel applications like ring, toothbrush, schoolbag, gloves, and so on. As a general purpose sensor node, WonderSense has embodied the experience and know-how of our team. Therefore, we will consistently improve its functionality and usability.     
WonderWonderは会津大学のネットワーク研究室から始まったチームです。実用性と利便性のあるWonderSenseをもっと多くの人の研究やアプリケーション開発で使用してもらいたいという思いのもと活動しています。

Mass Production
Sharing the ideals of making for makers and enabling IoT solutions, WonderWonder has partnered with FusionPCB to roll out mass production of WonderSense.With Seeed taking care of production,  WonderWonder can focus their passion in developing WonderSense.
WonderSenseの生産プロセスは、我々と理想を共有するFusionPCBに委託しています。無料の製造資料審査や、迅速な問い合わせへの対応など大変お世話になっています。
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Designing and programming hardware also developing applications such an SDK takes a lot of time and effort, but, we believe that this project is the first step toward our challenge and growth, and we enjoy it with a sense of unity. We enter the production process in the future, we may experience unprecedented risks and difficulties, but, we will enjoy that whilst completing this project.

However, there will be delays in production. We also expect to spend a lot of time verifying hardware and developing SDKs. For this reason, we set a sufficient period of 6 months for the delivery of the reward. We know you'll have to wait a little longer, but we promise we'll deliver it in the best possible condition.

ハードウェアの設計やプログラム、SDK等のアプリケーション開発までは多くの時間と労力がかかります。しかし我々はこのプロジェクト自体を、自分の挑戦と成長への第一歩と確信し、楽しみ、チームの一体感を感じながら活動しています。今後生産過程に入った際には、今までにないリスクや難しさを感じることもあると思いますが、それでさえも楽しみながらこのプロジェクトを完遂していきます。

しかし生産における遅延は間違いなく発生します。またハードウェアプログラムの検証やSDKの開発等で多くの時間を消費することになると考えています。そのためこのプロジェクトではリワードの発送まで6ヶ月という十分な期間を設けさせていただきました。少しおまたせすることになるかと思いますが、最高の状態でお届けすることを約束します。
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
WonderSense can be used anywhere, so we choose materials that have a certain degree of strength and shock resistance for the exterior. If the case is broken or damaged, you can make your own case with your own 3D printer using 3D data that we provide.

WonderSenseはあらゆる場所につけられる可能性があるため、外装部分にはある程度強度と耐衝撃性のある素材を選びます。また、外装が壊れてしまった場合にも所有している3Dプリンター等でケースを自作できるように3Dデータを公開します。

campaign.story:
Dear readers!
First of all, I would like to express my gratitude for your presence on my Kickstarter and for taking the time to read these lines. With all my heart, thank you! 
NEW ADDITION TO THE FIRST STRETCH GOAL (The Utility Pack):
ALSO, A big shout out to all of you supporting this project!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!
I am currently creating a set of printable 3D models (File format: STL).
This project will include a set of stackable Low Poly Animals that you will be able to pile vertically like a totem and make arrangements as you wish.
The Starter Pack will include:
A Pedestal Piece,
A Top Piece,
The 5 following animals : The Bear, The Fox, The Lynx, The Owl and The Wolf:
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

I am planning to play with these with my son. The goal of the game will be to try to pile the totem as high as possible without it falling of!
Also, for the 3D printing geeks, this is a nice way to finish the last bit of filament on a coil.
I am motivated to create more and more of these models. I think we will be able to reach the original goal so let's get crazy and continue with some extra goals!
The Utility Pack will include: An Adapter/Spacer, a Suspension System and a Lamp System.
This will make the totem possibilities even more flexible. You will be able to pile the heads of the totem in all the cardinal directions instead of just 6 directions.
In addition, there will be a blank hexagonal segment (with no head on it). You will be able to paint symbols, runes or whatever you want on it.
I will also add a version of the files with a suspension system in the back of the heads so you will be able to hang the totem on the wall as a decoration.
Plus! There will now be a system to transform any totem head into a lamp or a night light for your kid. You will just need to print the model with a translucent material (Per example translucent PLA filament).
PLAY

Stretch Goal: When we reach 200.00€ = GOAL ACHIEVED!! THANK YOU EVERYONE!!
The Earth Pack will include: 5 Land Animals
The Boar, The Buffalo, The Monkey, The Snake and The Stag.
Stretch Goal: When we reach 1000.00€
The Water Pack will include: 5 Aquatic Animals
The Beaver, The Dolphin, The Frog, The Otter and The Salmon.
Stretch Goal: When we reach 2000.00€
The Air Pack will include: 5 Air Animals
The 5 following animals: The Bat, The Crow, The Duck, The Eagle and The Falcon.
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 3000.00€
The Wing Pack will include: Wings!!!
New file versions for the Air Pack and the Owl. They will each have an insertion system and their respective wings.
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 5000.00€
The Fire Pack will include: 5 Magical Animals
The Cerberus, The Dragon, The Pegasus, The Phoenix and The Unicorn. The Dragon, The Pegasus and The Phoenix will each have an insertion system and their respective wings.
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 7500.00€ (Wings included)
The Body Pack will include: A new Adapter/Spacer Decorative Pack
There will be bodies created for all the animals from the previous Stretch Goals and from the Starter Pack. Even more totem possibilities!
Stretch Goal: When we will reach 10000.00€

The funds provided by my supporters will be used for supplies needed in developping my 3D modelling and printing business (PLA filament, printer and tech parts) any surplus will be used to open a savings fund for my son's education.
I have been a passionate graphic designer and photographer for over 20 years. What attracted me to the world of 3D is bringing to life what is in my mind. It has always been my childhood dream to invite people into my world and to share it with everyone.
3D modeling has been my main specialty for 12 years now and I have finally taken the leap of faith and started working on it full time. 3D printing has been a new emerging field for a few years now and I want to explore it more deeply. I am ready to dive into this new era with you. The ultimate achievement for a creator like me would be to be able to live from my passion. Therefore, since my work is without salary, I have decided to count on my potential supporters to generate enough income to live and support my small family.
For further information or to request my services, do not hesitate to contact me.
For whoever is interested, you can find all the crunchy details about my life on my Patreon page: https://www.patreon.com/stratationdesign3D
I would like to thank all the people who have supported me from the beginning: my dear mother, my sweetheart, my son, our families and friends.
I would also like to thank one of my Patrons, particularily Derek Thornton, for his participation in the creation process on my Patreon and for suggesting that I do this project!
And finally, thank you, dear readers, for reading this massive chunk of text!
Stratation
*** Version française ***
Chers lecteurs!
Tout d'abord, je tiens à vous exprimer ma gratitude pour votre présence sur mon Kickstarter et pour le temps que vous prenez pour lire ces lignes. De tout mon cœur, merci!
Les Animaux Totems LowPoly 3D Imprimables
Je suis en cours de création d'un ensemble de modèles 3D imprimables (format de fichier : STL).
Ce projet comprendra un ensemble d'animaux à faible polygones empilables que vous pourrez mettre les un par dessus les autres verticalement tel un totem et en faisant les arrangements que vous souhaitez.
Le Kit de Départ comprendra : Un Piédestal et Une Pièce de Dessus, L'Ours, Le Renard, Le Lynx, Le Hibou et Le Loup.
J'ai prévu de jouer avec ces animaux avec mon fils. Le but du jeu sera d'essayer d'empiler le totem aussi haut que possible sans qu'il ne tombe !
En plus, pour les geeks de l'impression 3D, c'est une belle façon de finir le dernier bout de filament sur une bobine.
Les Objectifs Supplémentaires
Je suis motivé à créer plus et plus encore de ces modèles. Je pense que nous devrions être en mesure d'atteindre l'objectif de bas fixé alors soyons fous et continuons avec quelques objectifs supplémentaires!
Le Kit Utilitaire : comprendra un Séparateur/Adaptateur, un Système de Suspension et un Système de Lampe
Ceci fera en sorte de rendre les possibilités du totem encore plus modulables. Vous pourrez empiler les têtes du totem dans toutes les directions cardinales au lieu de seulement 6 directions.
En supplément, il y aura un segment hexagonal neutre (sans tête dessus). Vous pourrez y peindre des symboles, des runes ou ce que vous voudrez.
J'ajouterai également une version des fichiers avec un système de suspension à l'arrière des têtes afin que vous puissiez accrocher le totem au mur en guise de décoration.
Et en plus ! Il y aura désormais un système permettant de transformer n’importe quelle tête du totem en lampe ou en veilleuse pour vos enfants. Il vous suffira d’imprimer le modèle avec un matériel translucide (par exemple un filament PLA translucide). Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 200.00€ = OBJECTIF ATTEINT!!! Merci à tous et à toutes!
Le Kit de la Terre : comprendra les 5 animaux terrestres suivants : Le Sanglier, Le Bison, Le Singe, Le Serpent et Le Cerf. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 1000.00€
Le Kit de l’Eau : comprendra es 5 animaux aquatiques suivants : Le Castor, Le Dauphin, La Grenouille, La Loutre et Le Saumon. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 2000.00€
Le Kit de l’Air : comprendra les 5 animaux aériens suivants : La Chauve-Souris, Le Corbeau, Le Canard, L’Aigle et Le Faucon. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 3000.00€
Le Kit des Ailes : comprendra de nouvelles versions de fichiers pour le Kit de l’Air et pour le Hibou. Ils auront un système d’insertion d’ailes et leurs ailes respectives. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 5000.00€
Le Kit du Feu : comprendra les 5 animaux magiques suivants : Le Cerbère, Le Dragon, Le Pégase, Le Phoenix et La Licorne. Le Dragon, Le Pégase et Le Phoenix auront un système d’insertion d’ailes et leurs ailes respectives. Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 7500.00€ (Ailes incluses)
Le Kit des Corps : comprendra un nouveau Kit de Séparateurs/Adaptateurs Décoratifs. Il y aura des corps créés pour tous les animaux des Objectifs Supplémentaires et du Kit de Départ. Encore plus de possibilités de totems ! Objectif Supplémentaire : Lorsque nous atteindrons 10000.00€
À quoi serviront les fonds?
Les fonds obtenus seront utilisés pour les fournitures nécessaires au développement de mon entreprise de modélisation et d'impression 3D (Filament PLA, imprimante et pièces techniques). Tout excédent sera utilisé pour ouvrir un fonds d'épargne pour l'éducation de mon fils.
Qui suis-je?
Je suis infographiste et photographe passionné depuis plus de 20 ans. Ce qui m’a attire dans le monde de la 3D, c’est le fait de concrétiser ce qu’il y a dans mes pensées. Ça a toujours été mon rêve d’enfant d’inviter les gens dans mon monde et de le partager avec tous.
La modélisation en 3D est ma principale spécialité depuis 12 ans maintenant et j'ai finalement fait le saut et commencé à y travailler à plein temps. L'impression 3D est un nouveau domaine émergent depuis quelques années maintenant et je veux l'explorer plus en profondeur. Je suis prêt à plonger dans cette nouvelle ère avec vous.
L’aboutissement ultime d’un créateur comme moi serait de pouvoir vivre de ma passion. Donc, comme mon travail n'est pas rémunéré, j'ai décidé de compter sur mes supporteurs potentiels pour générer un revenu suffisant pour vivre et faire vivre ma petite famille.
Pour de plus amples informations ou pour demander mes services, n'hésitez pas à me contacter.
Biographie
Pour ceux que cela intéresse, vous pouvez trouver tous les détails croustillants de ma vie sur ma page Patreon : https://www.patreon.com/stratationdesign3D
Remerciements
Je voudrais remercier toutes les personnes qui me soutiennent depuis mes débuts : ma chère maman, ma douce moitié, mon fils, nos familles et nos amis.
Je tiens aussi à remercier mes mécènes sur Patreon, surtout Derek Thornton, pour sa participation au processus de création sur mon Patreon et pour m'avoir suggéré de réaliser ce projet!
Finalement, merci à vous chers lecteurs, d'avoir lu ce morceau de texte massif!
Stratation

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Sustainable materials
We use PLA (Polylactic Acid) to print our samples and models and we hope you will do so too. PLA is composed of renewable raw materials and is biodegradable in industrial composting sites. It is also recyclable.

***

Nous utilisons du PLA (acide polylactique) pour imprimer nos échantillons et modèles et nous espérons que vous en ferez autant. Le PLA est composé de matières premières renouvelables et est biodégradable dans les sites de compostage industriels. Il est également recyclable.

support.title: Commercial License
support.descp:
You will be allowed to sell prints of the models from the Starter Pack and from all the future unlocked goals.
TERMS & CONDITIONS
You agree: to credit me as the artist, to link my Patreon page, that you will show pictures of the prints when selling them online.
You may not: use my photos, you will have to take your own photos for the prints you want to sell (no digital renders), sell or distribute my 3D files.
You may: make molds and paint the prints.
***
Vous serez autorisé à vendre des impressions des modèles du Kit de Départ et de tous les futurs objectifs débloqués.
CONDITIONS GÉNÉRALES
Vous acceptez de : me créditer en tant qu'artiste, mettre un lien vers ma page Patreon, montrer des photos des impressions lors de leur vente en ligne.
Vous ne pouvez pas : utiliser mes photos, vous devrez prendre vos propres photos pour les impressions que vous souhaitez vendre (aucun rendu numérique), vendre ou distribuer mes fichiers 3D.
Vous pouvez : faire des moules et peindre les modèles.

Yay!!!
There they are!!! I am announcing that the first shipment of files is here! So, I invite you to check your messages to get the Dropbox link. Don't hesitate to contact me if needed.

updates.update_userinfo: Complications during the test phase / Complications durant la phase de test
updates.update_content:
Dear supporters!
I was hoping I'd be able to deliver the files today... I'm sorry it won't be the case. Nevertheless, I have some information to share. As this is my first Kickstarter, I wasn't quite sure how long it would take for the Kickstarter team to send me the funds and I misjudged how long it would take. Long story short, I still haven't received the funds from Kickstarter, so I had to take from my family budget to order the PLA to get it in time. And yet, I only just received it. I guess because of the lockdown and the measures related to CoVid-19, the delivery must have been delayed a bit, but here they are at last: the PLA coils are here!

updates.update_userinfo: It's almost the end... / C'est presque la fin...
updates.update_content:
I am currently waiting for the fund transfer to be able to order more PLA filament coils to proceed to the final tests and to take more pictures and videos. I used the few PLA I had left to test many of the options already and everything is working. There is only one thing left to test printing : the mural suspension option from the Utility Pack.
I'll keep you inform of the progress of course ;). If my estimates are correct, I should be proceeding with the delivery around the week of May 18th 2020.

updates.update_userinfo: The PLA coils are here / Les bobines de PLA sont arrivées
updates.update_content:
I am very grateful and sincerely touched by the generosity and the support from all my supporters during this campaign. With all my heart, thank you so very much!
Tons of love!!
Stratation
PS: If you liked my work and still want to support me behond this campaign, you can find me on Patreon.

campaign.story:
We used to spend thousands of dollars on 3D printers since 2012. At that time, 3D printer could only be used by the designers and makers. Yes, now is 2020, we found lots of team and company build different kinds of 3D printer. They all try their best to make 3D printers accessible to family and kids.
We believe 3DFORD is the most affordable 3D printer that can be used right out of the box. We made the UNI-BODY design, So it's perfect for beginners! 
No more assemble! 3DFORT is not that kind of 3D printer kits, 3DFORT comes ready out of the box. 
With toy bricks compatible, we’re making it more interesting than ever for beginners and children to get started with 3D printer! You could decorate the 3DFORT by toy bricks. Even you could 3D print some custom design blocks to mount it on.


Watch your custom creations form right before your eyes!
Kickstarter Standard Print printed by 3DFORT: 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lBLWuognxSR8DGp8524xLy2k9BJXEPGh/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1esZCYeEB2uSS3jJYkp5wA7pWdlC37MfO/view?usp=sharing 
Mini-figure model:
PLAY

mini-figure model
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

Like we said, we try to make 3DFORT funny and easy to use. So we design this extruder with one -push insert function. Also, you could use it to remove the filament. So it could help you to print the multi-color creation easily.
Nozzle As Add-On: Extra One Nozzle  $0.6 USD (HK$ 4.7)
You can choose the Nozzle Size from: 0.1mm, 0.2mm, 0.3mm, 0.4mm.
How to add Nozzle as Add-Ons to pledge?
 Filament As Add-On: 500g $15USD (HK$ 116), one color (shipping included)
                                         1Kg    $20USD(HK$155), one color (shipping included)
1.75mm pla is recommended. Except pla, 1.75mm materials with working temperature less than 240℃ can also be used.
In fact, we will also randomly send some filaments for testing the printer.
How to add filaments as Add-Ons to pledge?
After collecting many kinds of 3D printer plate, we chose to design a new one. Perfect for PLA 3D printing. 

There are of things you can print out with 3DFORT 3D printer. The list goes on and on but some examples are toys, household items, replacement/spare parts, and more! 
PLAY

PLAY

There are plenty of free 3D modeling software out there such as; Google SketchUp, tinkercad.com. 3D Printer Beginners: Go to thingiverse.com. 
Check out all the different designs people have created. When you see something you like, It's as easy as power on 3DFORT, downloading that design, Slicing the 3D model and then let the printer do the work!
Meet The Team: Hi! We are 3DFORT 3D Printer Team, from Jinan Qingshan Plastic Industry Co., LTD. (济南青山塑业有限公司) Yes! The handsome man who designed the mold is also the legal representative of our company. Based on rich experience in production and processing of plastic products, we’ve gone one step further by developing this 3DFORT for you! Whether you are beginner or expert, we want everyone who has creative ideas could hold it in their hands!

campaign.story:
👋 This is the Frame.IoT
The Frame.IoT is an Arduino-compatible board built for your Internet of Things projects and ships with the most popular components built-in — voted by the community. Now you can focus on building something awesome (instead of wiring up the basics). 
📶 It's the easiest way to connect Things
No matter what those Things are...
Frame.IoT integrates with IFTTT so you can stay in touch with your furry friends. Click to see how!
💪 Everything you need
Powered by the ESP-32, the Frame.IoT is Wi-Fi and Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) enabled. We packed it with all the plug-and-play utilities you've come to expect — USB-to-Serial converter, automatic bootloader reset and Lithium Ion/Polymer battery charging circuit. To make it project-ready, we gave the Frame.IoT a microSD card socket for all your data logging/storage needs, a super powerful digital audio amp to stream audio over the internet and blast notifications, a 16-pixel addressable RGB LED ring to light up your project, a toggle that lets you choose to power your peripherals over USB or battery, and an unencumbered momentary push-button to trigger any action you choose.  
Build awesome apps to connect to your Frame.IoT with Blynk
🙅‍♂️ No wasted pins
Not all projects are created equal. If your prototype doesn't need some of the components built-in to the Frame.IoT — no worries! Each component is connected via jumper pins. Simply remove the corresponding jumpers and you'll free up the I/O for anything you want!
👀 Easy on the eyes & wallet 💰
Stop wrestling with a rainbow of jumper wires and breadboards. Frames are designed to declutter your projects — making it faster to get your prototype working and easier to deploy your idea in its final form factor and enclosures.
The built-in components not only make building and troubleshooting easier but more affordable than sourcing them separately.
🛠 Crowd & open sourced
We've built a community of makers who collaborate and vote on each Frame, its purpose, and its components. We release all our fabrication files publicly so you can go from prototype to production.  Cast your first vote to see how it works! 
♾ Endless possibilities
The Frame.IoT is a platform for all your Internet of Things projects. Add sensors, relays, and any other component to build anything you can dream up:
A bluetooth, mobile app-controlled robotic car
A smart home-connected plant water level sensor
A real-time Bitcoin or stock ticker with LED indications
A weather logging sensor — using the ESP-32 deep sleep to log all year on a single charge
PLAY

Here's a few sketches we built using nothing more than the Frame.IoT, a speaker, battery, and existing Arduino libraries!
🚨 Using the NeoPixelBus library to show off our 16 addressable RGB LEDs:
🔊 Using the ESP8266Audio library to stream a live radio station off a battery: 
PLAY

  🔘 Using the built-in pushbutton to log presses: 
 🔋 Reading the voltage of the battery:
 🏆 Pledge tiers
No fancy graphics needed here. Every pledge tier (except the $1 tier) comes with one Frame.IoT and jumper pins. The Bundle also includes a 350mAh rechargeable battery, 2GB microSD card, 4 ohm 3W speaker, and USB cable.
If you'd like multiple Frame.IoTs, simply add an additional $39 (for just the board) or $59 USD (for The Bundle) to your pledge.
(Shipping will be collected after Kickstarter and is expected to average $10-$20 USD depending on location and pledge quantity.)
🥅 Stretch goals
If we're able to raise $30k, we'll make the Frame.IoT.Breadboard available to our backers — a prototyping shield for the Frame.IoT which makes it easier to add your own additional sensors and components.
Not convinced from this terrible drawing that we can execute on this idea if we hit the stretch goal? The Frame.IoT.Breadboard shield will consist of simple stacking headers and a breadboard (shaped in a way to give you access to your screw terminals and JST connectors).
* The Frame.IoT.Breadboard is an additional $15 and will be collected after Kickstarter for those who'd like to add one.
🤯 Get a free board with our referral program
We need all the help we can to get Frame.IoT into the workshops of makers around the world. Sign up to get your unique sharing link and get rewarded for each of your friends who pledge (any tier besides the $1 pledge).
 1 referral = Your name in the Superbacker Section of our Github repo
 3 referrals = You'll get The Frame.IoT.Breadboard ($15 value), a prototyping shield for the Frame.IoT
 5 referrals = You'll get The Frame.IoT ($39 value) for free
 7 referrals = You'll get The Frame.IoT and The Frame.IoT.Breadboard ($54 value) for free
 10 referrals = You'll get The Bundle ($59 value) for free
 15 referrals = You'll get The Bundle and The Frame.IoT.Breadboard ($74 value) for free
🤙 What about free stickers?
Are you easily pressured by small rewards? Are you one of the billions of people on social media? Do you like adhesives? If so, send us a screenshot of you sharing this project on two platforms and we'll add a limited edition Kickstarter sticker to your shipment (or put your name in the Superbacker section of our Github if you didn't back a tier that includes shipping).
Don't know what to say? Start here for Facebook and Twitter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're several rounds into prototyping and feel confident we've de-risked this project from a functionality perspective. We have one last prototyping run (to validate small, mostly-aesthetic changes to the version of the board featured in this campaign).

One of the biggest potential challenges we have to face is the Coronavirus (COVID-19) and its affect on our supply chain. The last two prototyping runs we sent to manufacturing took nearly 3 months (as opposed to the typical 30-day lead time) due to factory closures amongst our component suppliers, PCB fabricator, and assembly partners. We've tried to overestimate lead times as delivering on (or before) our timeline is a top priority (second to delivering a high-quality product) and we'll communicate clearly (and with proof) if factory closures or delays prevent this from happening.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
We built the Frame.IoT to be more than just "another" board in your drawer. With a modular design, you'll be able to leverage the components that are important to you without wasting those that aren't.

Our designs are completely open source and can be forked on Github which lets future makers reuse our proven schematics (meaning less waste and prototyping when launching their own projects).

Single hand operation for speed and safety, letting you have one hand for the Platyball and the other hand on the shutter button or lens.
PLAY

CHARLES MARING DESCRIBES THE PERFORMANCE AND FEATURES OF BOTH PLATYBALL PROTOTYPES.

Shipping estimates per Platyball (Ergo or Elite):  United States: $15 | Canada: $25 | EU: $39 | Japan: $39 | South Africa: $55 | Rest of World: $49

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Platyball® project has been 4 years in the making. The biggest hurdle was searching far and wide for the finest designers and engineers to help bring our dream to a reality. We have an amazing team assembled that was able to incorporate our requests and achieve a product that was previously thought to be impossible. Our prototypes work well, but we will continue over the next several months to tweak and refine the product so that when it goes into production it will be perfect. 
We have essentially invested everything we have earned from the past few years of Platypod® sales and more to bring the Platyball® dream to fruition. We now look to the generous support of our backers to help us move into the next phase.
We have applied very conservative projections for delivery dates because our plan includes extensive pre-production testing and room to make revisions as needed so that the product our backers receive will meet all expectations. 
Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
As usual, Platypod is only using the highest quality materials in their products, such as aircraft grade aluminum, stainless steel and durable teflon type plastics. Everything is corrosion proof and built to last. Mechanicals are backed by a 3-year warranty and electronics are weather sealed and covered by a 1-year warranty.

updates.update_content:
If you haven't already done so, please read updates number 17, 18 & 19 to bring yourself up to speed. 
The good news is, three days after our last update, which coincided with Thanksgiving day here in the US, our factory in Taiwan began working on production molds for both Platyball Ergo and Elite. I just spoke with Von Davis, production engineer over at Amtech, and we are on track to receive our first production-level samples around April 15 as planned. We have ordered 40 units of each model. The vast majority of these will be kept in Taiwan for several weeks of vigorous testing. We will receive about six to ten of each for our own testing.

campaign.story:
CloverPI.com 
Ok we all like Pi.  Hey who doesn't.  But we most of all like Raspberry Pis.  They are such versatile little boards used by many project makers.  There are a TON of makers out there that have projects that involve multiple Raspberry Pis.  Anyone who makes these projects knows that for every Raspberry Pi you need a power supply and a network cable assuming you are going to network these bad boys together.  That means you need a switch and need to power that too.  So we thought wouldn't it be great if we can just plug these Raspberry Pis into a board and let that handle all that? 
Enter CLoverPI...

 So What does CloverPI actually do...
Well I'm glad you asked.  It takes Raspberry Pis, wired Ethernet, power supplies and put them all into 1 unit with just a single power supply and optionally external network connection

CloverPi features
Backplane compatible with any Raspberry Pis containing the standardized GPIO pins
 Integrated power for four raspberry pies
Individual power switches for each raspberry pi
Individually addressable RGB LED for each raspberry pi
Link light for Network for each raspberry pi
Network header for each raspberry pi
5 Port gigabit switch: four ports for raspberry Pi's one for uplink
Possible use cases(to name a few)
K8s
Docker swarm
Full stack development via openstack
Small office server stack
Open Flickr stack
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the main challenges have been having is the we keep wanting to add additional features to this board. So we have had to set a hard cutoff and stop trying to make changes to this project and just do it. We have decided to get input from our backers for possible updates and feature sets they might find most beneficial to a device like this.

Depending on the demand on this project we may need to look into alternative production methods. Currently we buy the individual components do the soldering/assembly ourselves. Purchasing the components in bulk would not be a problem but mass producing this could be one of our biggest challenges. Because of this we have kept the levels at a modest level that we are comfortable with. We also have been prepping additional resources should the interest level and response be better than expected.

We have been looking at ways to streamline the process and make the assembly of the boards more efficient.

We have undergone several design modifications through out the past year to bring to the KickStarter community a version we feel will meet the needs of the maker community and can reliably be produced with a minimal level of variations and defects.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All,
There has been a temporary shipping delay on our CloverPI fulfillments due to our power supply supplier sending us a shipment of incorrect power supplies. We are having to sort through all our current stock of power supplies and all our CloverPi's that we have had packaged ready for shipment to sort out which are the incorrect ones and get replacements. Some backers have already received the incorrect power supplies and we are working with those backers to get them the correct ones.

Hello Backers!

It has been a while since our last update. We have a few things to
update you on.

We paused shipping out CloverPis for two reasons.  The first is we
have had 2 major hurricanes come through our area. Don't worry
operations were not harmed, just delayed.   Second was that we had a
couple reports of "fires" from the CloverPis.  We spent days trying to
replicate the issue using the CloverPi normally, We were only able to
replicate the issue when we shorted the positive to negative in
various ways.  We are updating our packaging and getting started guide
with the following to help avoid the issue.

Hello Backers!

We have a few things to update everyone about today.

Shipping Times
First the update everyone wants: Clovers are shipping out weekly.

Because of COVID-19, some of our suppliers were having issues
fulfilling orders, which delayed some backer rewards. However, we have
partnered with a manufacturer to streamline our fulfillment process,
and CloverPis are shipping weekly.

We’re fulfilling in the order stated in the rewards. All super early
birds have been shipped. We are currently working on double early
birds. All other doubles are on track to be shipped by the end of
August.

If you have any questions, you can always send me a message to


Backer Survey
For those that have already filled out the backer survey, thank you.
If you have not
filled out the survey, please check your email or your Kickstarter
profile for a link to it, This is where we get your information for
the reward shipment.


Web site and store
Our web site is being updated to include new tutorials.

The CloverPi store will soon offer preorders, which will be fulfilled
after all Kickstarter rewards are fulfilled.

In response to backer feedback, we have some new ideas in the works.
Stay turned for our add-on board, the CloverIO.

We read all your comments and questions here on the Kickstarter, but
we’re still having some issues with Kickstarter notifications. If you
have any questions, an email to will get the fastest
reply.


Thanks,
The CloverPi Team

Hey everyone,

   We haven't been getting notifications when comments are posted on
the Kickstarter page.

We've been communicating with folks and answering questions via email,
and we thought we were also getting notified whenever anyone posted
here.

You're also always welcome to contact us at .

Thanks,
The CloverPi Team

Hey everyone, 
CloverPis were mailed to super early bird backers last week. You may already have yours in hand, or it may arrive very soon. You can find assembly instructions and other info about getting started with your CloverPi at http://cloverpi.com/getting-started-with-the-cloverpi/"
Double Super Early Bird backers are being prepared and will begin shipping this week!!!

Hey everyone, We're excited to let you know that we've started shipping the first batch of CloverPis. If you were a super early bird backer, you should be receiving tracking info in an email by 07-20-2020.

updates.update_userinfo: Finally!!! Shipping is about to begin
updates.update_content:
My Apologies to all our backers.  The whole Covid-19 has been causing havoc with us all and unfortunately CloverPI was not immune.  
BUT...I am glad to say that we have finally received the last items we needed.  We are now able to begin shipping The CloverPi boards to our backers.  Strangely enough it was not even the parts we were ordering from overseas but the items from vendors here in the US that were causing the delays.

All,
I would like to thank all out backers and provide and update to our progress.  
We have received our kickstarter funds a little less than 2 weeks ago
We have our machines tooled and setup and soldering the components to the CloverPi Board
All parts have been received or in shipment to our locations

The entire CloverPi team would like to thank all our backers for their support.
Over the next 2 weeks we will be sending out surveys to gather additional information so that we can fulfill the rewards.  If any of our backers have any questions please message us and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
Please be patient.  Right now we are working diligently to get production and fulfillment underway

campaign.story:
The stars of this epic sci-fi adventure series.

SUCCESS!!! We hit our goal in less than a week!
Time for some STRETCH GOALS!
STRETCH GOAL #1 -- $55,000
 UNUSED PITCHES TO STAR TREK! Marc will open up and discuss his unused Star Trek pitches - that's The Next Generation, Deep Space Nine, Voyager, and Enterprise! ALL DONORS -- big and small -- will receive a PDF package of scripts and outlines of these wonderfully creative Star Trek ideas, as well as a video of Marc discussing them and the pitching process! 
STRETCH GOAL #2 -- coming soon!


Space Command is a science fiction series starring legends of sci-fi and the silver screen such as Doug Jones, Nichelle Nichols, Robert Picardo, Mira Furlan, Bill Mumy, Faran Tahir, James Hong, Bruce Boxleitner, John Harney, John Hennigan, Sean Kenney, and many more big names to be announced soon!
This epic series that transcends a decades-long story is through the lens of a hopeful vision of the future, written by Marc Scott Zicree who has writing credits on dozens of shows over the past 40 years -- Star Trek: The Next Generation, Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5, Sliders, The Real Ghostbuster, Smurfs, He-Man, as well as the "Magic Time" series of novels and the definitive "Twilight Zone Companion" series of books.
Space Command Forgiveness part 2
"Space Command Forgiveness Part 2"  is the fourth one-hour episode in this epic science fiction adventure series. This campaign is to fund the production of Chapter 3 (our $48k goal), and then Chapter 4 (Stretch Goal), which are the two chapters within this one-hour fourth episode.* 
*To learn exactly what all this means, scroll down to the "where are we now?" section below.
WE HAVE REWARD ADD-ONS!! Scroll down to the PERKS/ADD-ONS section below.
Space Command Forgiveness, parts 1&2 movie poster

These are some of the science fiction icons that support Space Command
Recognize any of these names?
Space command stars many, many science fiction legends, past and present! We've still got a few more BIG casting announcements coming! When we cast more actors, we'll be adding them below! 
Big Trouble in Little China
WWE Wrestling, GLOW
Star Trek, Iron Man

ALSO IN THE SPACE COMMAND SERIES
Babylon 5, Lost
The Shape of Water, Star Trek: Discovery, Pan's Labyrinth, Falling Skies
Total Recall, Star Trek: Voyager, Stargate
Star Trek: Deep Space Nine, Babylon 5, Lost in Space
Babylon 5, Tron
Orange is the New Black
New Additions:
We've just added SEAN KENNEY to the cast! He played Captain Pike in the original Star Trek series!
The Assassin's Apprentice, Star Trek
Additional stars
Space Command also has a group of incredible up-and-coming Hollywood actors in starring and supporting roles. Here they are:
Ethan McDowell, Sara Maraffino, Nathaniel Freeman, Victor Manso
Dallas Malloy, Bryan McClure, Barbara Lee Bragg, Ryan T. Husk
Coley Speaks, Elle Sonnet, Justin Sorvillo, Jelena Mrdja
Marc & Elaine Zicree have written and produced hundreds of hours of series TV, pilots and feature films for most of the major studios and networks, including Paramount, Universal, Disney, Sony/Columbia Tri-Star, MGM, Warners, Castle Rock, New Line, CBS, NBC, ABC, Fox, WB, UPN, Showtime, PBS, Turner, USA Networks, Syfy, Discovery, Nickelodeon, the BBC, Marvel, Scholastic, ITV and NPR. Among their credits are classic episodes of Star Trek – The Next Generation, Sliders, Babylon 5, Deep Space Nine, Friday the 13th – The Series, Smurfs, Superfriends, He-Man, Captain Power and the Soldiers of the Future, The Littles, Forever Knight, Liberty’s Kids and The Real Ghostbusters, among many others.
Marc and Elaine’s work has been nominated for the Hugo Award, American Book Award, Humanitas Prize, Nebula Award and Diane Thomas Award, and has won the prestigious Hamptons Prize, TV Guide Award, Rondo and Saturn Awards. In 2014, Marc was named a Writers Guild Diversity Honoree.
Marc and Elaine Zicree, co-directing on the set of Space Command.
A word from creator, Marc Zicree:
"As a kid I loved STAR TREK, TWILIGHT ZONE, OUTER LIMITS, FORBIDDEN PLANET and grew up to write for such great shows as STAR TREK – THE NEXT GENERATION, DEEP SPACE NINE, BABYLON 5, SLIDERS and more.
I often hear fans say, “Why are there so few good sci-fi shows on TV, and why do so many go south?” I can tell you – frankly, most of the network suits just don’t get it.
But you and I do.
So when I recently got the idea of creating a new show inspired by the sense of wonder and possibility science fiction gave me as a kid, I realized I didn’t need a network or studio to make my dream come true -- just Kickstarter and you.
Thanks for making it happen."

Where are we now?
This is the progress of the Space Command epic series. Episodes are coupled, into two-parters. For example, episodes one and two are coupled, three and four are coupled, etc.. Each episode is one hour, divided into two 30-minute chapters.
SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION part 1 (episode 1)
 Chapter 1 - filmed, completed, and released!
 Chapter 2 - filmed, completed, and released!
SPACE COMMAND: REDEMPTION part 2 (episode 2)
 Chapter 3 - filmed, postproduction is funded and nearly complete!
 Chapter 4 - filmed, postproduction is funded and nearly complete!
SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS part 1 (episode 3)
 Chapter 1 - filmed, postproduction, editing, VFX, are being completed
 Chapter 2 - filmed, postproduction, editing, VFX, are being completed
SPACE COMMAND: FORGIVENESS part 2 (episode 4)
 Chapter 3 - in preproduction - our first goal is to fund this chapter 
 Chapter 4 - in preproduction - our stretch goal will be to fund this chapter

ADD-ONS
Do you want to SAVE MONEY? Do you want screen credit and IMDb credit, but don't want DVDs? Do you prefer not to have more "stuff?" Do you want to avoid shipping costs? Well...
You can now add-on any credit (screen credit and IMDb) you'd like to you reward level! Here's how.
Choose the reward level that has the package you want. When you click on it, you will be given the option to ADJUST YOUR PLEDGE by typing in any number or dollar amount you'd like.  Simply add the amount that corresponds to the credit you want from the list below:
Thanks +40
Special Thanks +15
Very Special Thanks +15
Production Associate +100
Prod Executive +150
Contributing Producer +200
Associate Producer +200
Co-Producer +600
Producer +1700
CO-Executive Producer +1800
Executive Producer +2500

EXAMPLES: 
You can donate $1 and add $40 for a THANK credit. Total: $41.
If your reward level comes with a SPECIAL THANKS credit but you want a PRODUCTION ASSOCIATE credit, simply add $115 (15 to reach the very special thanks credit  + 100 to get the production associate credit).
If you don't want ANY perks and just want the contributing producer credit, just pledge at the $1 level and add all the add-on prices up to and including contributing producer (1+40+15+15+100+150+200) for a total of $521.
So now you can avoid getting things you don't want as well as incurring shipping costs for these items. You'll just GET WHAT YOU WANT and SAVE MONEY!!
We'll take care of the rest! (But if you'd like to shoot us a message to reconfirm or ask questions, once the campaign is over, feel free!)
.

Risks and challenges
Raising funds via crowd funding is very difficult. But we are confident in our product and confident in the support of the fantastic fans of the science fiction community. Together, we can make this series come to life!
