campaign.story:
Bangle.js is an open, hackable smartwatch. 
You can easily install new apps from the web or develop your own using JavaScript or a graphical programming language (Blockly). All you need is a Web Browser (Chrome, Edge or Opera) and you can upload apps or write code to run on your watch wirelessly! Bangle.js is waterproof and AI enabled and comes with bluetooth low energy, GPS, a heart rate monitor, accelerometer and more.
Want to know more?
 Nearform gave out pre-release Bangle.js watches to everyone at the NodeConf EU conference. They have a write-up, and you can also  see what they're saying on Twitter! 
You can also check out the documentation put together by the Nearform for the conference, which covers getting started with the watches - bear in mind that these are still pre-release watches!
Hackster has an interview and article about Bangle.js 
Gordon was a guest on the SAP Labs Talk Podcast 
Heise.de has an article (in German) about Bangle.js too 
There are also articles in Computer Weekly, FOSSBytes, CNX Software, IT Knowledge Exchange, and many others 

Hardware Specs 
IP68 Waterproof: up to 10m underwater
Nordic 64MHz nRF52832 ARM Cortex-M4 processor with Bluetooth LE
64kB RAM 512kB on-chip flash, 4MB external flash
1.3 inch 240x240 16 bit LCD display with 2 zone touch
GPS/Glonass receiver (UBlox)
Heart rate monitor
3 Axis Accelerometer (with Pedometer and Tap detect)
3 Axis Magnetometer
Piezo speaker and Vibration motor
350mAh battery, 1 week standby time
5 x 5 x 1.7 cm case, plastic with stainless steel ring
Can be disassembled with just 4 screws
  Software Specs
Easy to code and debug wirelessly using JavaScript or our graphical editor (based on Blockly)
Pre-programmed with the Espruino Open Source JavaScript interpreter 
Vast majority of JavaScript ES5 features and many ES6 features including: Regular Expressions, Promises, Arrow Functions, Template Literals
40kB RAM for program memory/variables
Bluetooth 4.2 Advertising, Central and Peripheral mode support with built-in Nordic UART service
Graphics library with Vector fonts, bimap rotate & scale
Tensorflow Lite for Microcontrollers AI
Wear-levelled flash filesystem
Heatshrink compression
Upload functions written in C or ARM Assembler
Built-in wireless debugging
VT100 Terminal support on LCD
Program with Web-based Web Bluetooth IDE or Node.js-based command line tools
  Apps 
Because Bangle.js is entirely open, you can upload the apps we’ve already developed, create your own, or upload apps created by the online community.
Our app store (at banglejs.com/apps) will be entirely free. We’ll never share your data with third parties or make your use of our apps dependent on third party cloud services. So far we’ve created some great apps including games, a compass, map, spirit level, QR code display and heart rate monitor (to name a few) and we have lots more to come.
We already have a great online community (our forum has over 35,000 posts!) and we’re excited to see what apps you come up with!
DroidScript support
We'll also be working with David from DroidScript to make sure that there's a nice, easy way for you to write Android phone apps in JavaScript that will talk to Bangle.js. While Bangle.js can work completely independently (and we'll have Gadgetbridge for notifications from your phone), DroidScript provides a fast, easy way to use your phone's internet connection to push data to Bangle.js in the background using the same JavaScript language.
Who are we?
I’m Gordon Williams, the creator of Bangle.js. I’m a software engineer who loves tinkering with hardware. 7 years ago I became frustrated with the steep learning curve required to create software for microcontrollers and started working on Espruino. I’ve been working full-time on it since the end of the first Espruino KickStarter campaign in 2013. My work is Open Source and funded by sales of my Espruino devices and the support of the online community via Patreon.
Since Espruino’s first KickStarter campaign, I (with a bit of help from family and friends) have:
Shipped over 30,000 official Espruino devices
Developed 5 further Espruino devices (including the wifi board, Pico, Puck.js, Pixl.js and the MDBT42Q breakout board)
Launched and successfully delivered two more KickStarter campaigns
Written over 11,000 forum posts
Produced over 100 online tutorials and over 90 YouTube videos for Espruino
Fixed over 1500 GitHub issues for the Espruino project
Made over 3700 GitHub commits in Espruino, and many more in other Espruino-related projects like the IDE.
  Several others have provided a huge amount of help with Bangle.js: Nearform Research has done a lot of work on the AI, apps, documentation, testing and publicity for their Nodeconf EU conference, and Fanoush's work on nRF52-based smart bands was instrumental when figuring out how to replace Bangle.js's factory firmware.
Why Bangle.js?
It feels great to use things you’ve made, but even if you are an experienced hardware designer it’s difficult to make yourself a watch that is reliable and useful long term, let alone waterproof and affordable.There’s some amazing hardware already out there, but it’s usually crippled by bad software and isn't supported of upgraded.
That’s why we decided to take a powerful, well-designed Smartwatch that already exists, completely reverse engineer it and replace all of its firmware with our Open Source software to really unlock its capabilities.
Why JavaScript?
Developing software for embedded devices can be a real pain. You normally need wires attached to the device you’re developing for, and you need to install and set up a complex toolchain. Anything more than a few lines of code can take a minute or more to compile and upload to the chip, and this applies to every change you make. Many tools don’t even allow for debugging.
Bangle.js has none of those problems. The Espruino JavaScript interpreter allows you to upload code and debug wirelessly out of the box using just a Web Browser, with no need to install software on your computer.
Tensorflow Lite AI
Tensorflow Lite for Microcontrollers is built into  Bangle.js’s firmware so you can run machine learning models wirelessly on your wrist! This allows you to detect gestures using the accelerometer. If you’re feeling adventurous you can customise the data you collect and create or update machine learning models without even having to reboot your watch!
Simply train and test your model on your PC with Tensorflow, then create a tflite model and upload it to your watch.
Open Source
Bangle.js uses the Open Source (MPLv2) Espruino JavaScript interpreter. All source code, tools and documentation are provided under an Open Source licence.
We’re using an existing watch so we can’t provide original schematics (we don’t have any!), however the information we have gained from reverse engineering the watches will be made Open Source.
What do you get?
If your reward contains a Bangle.js, you’ll get a box containing:
A Bangle.js Smartwatch
A Magnetic USB charge cord
Getting Started instructions
Depending on which reward you chose, you may get other Espruino Bluetooth boards as well. These all run JavaScript, can communicate with Bangle.js, and are programmed with the Espruino Web IDE. From left to right:
 Espruino Puck.js - a small, self-contained Bluetooth button with 3 axis magnetometer
 Espruino MDBT42Q breakout board - a tiny, low power Bluetooth board that can run off a wide range of voltages and fit on a breadboard
 Espruino Pixl.js - a low power Bluetooth LCD with Arduino pinout
Multiple Rewards?
Want something that there isn't a reward for? You can select one reward and then pledge extra - for instance if you wanted two Bangle.js and a MDBT42 board (above), you could select the 'Hackers Edition' and pledge £117 (£60 + £10 + £47), the cost of the Hackers edition with postage, plus a single Bangle.js.
Current Status
We’ve just purchased and programmed 400 watches for the attendees of the Nodeconf EU Conference running from 10th-13th November 2019, so we’re confident in our ability to source and program the hardware. While the firmware is very capable right now (as shown in the video), there is still a lot that we’re planning  to do:
More applications
Documentation, examples and tutorials
Adding features to the firmware (pedometer, etc)
Power usage profiling and improvements
Testing and bug fixing
  We’re confident that we can get this done  and ship your rewards in time, as we have with our previous KickStarter campaigns. As with our other Espruino devices, Bangle.js will continue to receive software updates long after this campaign ends.
Production Timeline
Because we’re using existing hardware, our timeline is a lot easier than it has been for previous products, but we’re trying to set realistic deadlines with some wiggle room in case there’s a delay in production at the factory.
 Now: further development of Bangle.js firmware, documentation and apps
 End of November: KickStarter finishes
 Mid December: funds clear, watches ordered, beta test watches programmed and shipped
 Early February: watches arrive
 February/March: watch programming, packing and shipping
  THE PIXELMASTER
The Pixelmaster is a graphical representation of all the amazing support we receive during this KickStarter campaign. Every Bangle.js will have an ‘About’ screen built into the firmware, and everyone who buys a Bangle.js will get to choose the colour of 9 pixels on the screen from the 16 colour Mac palette:
 Backers who pledge additional support will get an extra pixel per £1 pledged. But which pixels? You get to choose! Those with most pixels chose first, and if you have the same number of pixels as someone else, you get first dibs if you pledged first.
Stretch Goals
£40,000 (ACHIEVED): You can write simple code graphically right now, but if we reach this stretch goal we’ll be extending our graphical editor with support for Graphics, Menus and Images. This will make it even easier to create good-looking apps without any coding knowledge.
£75,000 (ACHIEVED) : We’ll add an online file system to the Espruino Web IDE so you don’t need to save your apps or code you’re working on to your computer. This means you’ll be able to develop, access and save your apps easily from anywhere at any time.
£100,000 (ACHIEVED) : Optimised graphics mode for games. Bangle.js already has an unbuffered 240x240x16 bit graphics mode, as well as a double-buffered 240x160x16 bit mode. With this stretch goal we'll be adding low-resolution 8 bit buffered graphics which will make it much easier to write full-colour, fast moving games (and other graphics).
Small Print
We pride ourselves on being open - not just with Open Source software, but about everything. Bangle.js is a pretty awesome piece of hardware, and is great value at this price, but there are a few things that aren’t perfect. So that you’re not disappointed, we think you ought to know that:
We’re shipping from the UK - if you are not in Europe you may be liable to import taxes.
The touchscreen is two zone (not full touch)
The piezo speaker is pretty quiet
The heart rate monitor doesn’t always read accurately when you’re moving around
We’ll be adding support for notifications from GadgetBridge on Android, but don’t have any plans to support iOS.
Web Bluetooth works on Windows 10, Mac OS, Chromebook, Android and Linux. iOS requires a cheap paid app (WebBLE). While we have a native application for programming Bangle.js in Windows 8 and earlier, there is currently no Web Bluetooth support.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're trying hard to reduce risks as much as possible by sourcing existing hardware and then installing our software on it (this means we’re not wholly reliant on the factory to source the watches). We've already purchased 400 watches and programmed them for Nodeconf EU, so we're confident in our supply chain and ability to program the watches.

However that's not to say that things can't go wrong. In the process of getting this far we ported Espruino to 3 different watches from different manufacturers before we found a manufacturer and watch we were confident in. If everything goes seriously wrong and we have to port to another watch then we’re confident that we can do that - the specs and look of the watch may change and there may be a month or two’s delay but you will still receive watches that provide the same experience. This won’t affect any beta-testing rewards.

Brexit: This will only affect non-UK EU residents. At some point in the future it seems likely that the UK will exit the EU, and while it is likely we will only do so with a deal that allows free exchange of goods, there is a small chance that we will leave with ‘no deal’ on 31 January 2020. If this is the case, we’ll foot the bill and will ensure that you get your goods without paying extra taxes.

The final issue worth mentioning is that while there is a great Espruino community, Gordon Williams is almost entirely responsible for the Bangle.js KickStarter campaign, and he and his wife are expecting a baby in mid-December! He will be taking paternity leave and working part-time over Christmas and New Year. We’ve taken this into account in our timeline and believe that there’s still enough time to deliver on our KickStarer commitments.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
We’ve deliberately chosen hardware for Bangle.js that is reliable and easy to maintain. The watch itself can be opened with 4 screws, and if the rechargeable battery fails it can be replaced. Nothing is glued shut on this device! Bangle.js is designed to function independently of other devices and services (if required), so whatever happens in the future you’ll be able to turn on your Bangle.js and use it.

We’re committed to long term support. The very first board we made from the first KickStarter campaign is still receiving updates 6 years later (and will benefit from the work we do on Bangle.js). Bangle.js will be no different and will continue to be supported and improve as time goes on.

updates.update_userinfo: Puck.js rewards shipping later this week
updates.update_content: I'm glad to announce that we finally have the Puck.js v2s assembled. They should be delivered here tomorrow, and I'll ship them out on Thursday and Friday.

updates.update_userinfo: Apps, Shipping and Puck.js v2 status
updates.update_content:
Hi, I thought I'd give you a quick update on how everything is going...
Apps
There have been loads of new apps contributed to Bangle.js now. It's worth checking out https://banglejs.com/apps/ as it seems new applications and updates get added daily.
Thank you to everyone who has contributed - I'm absolutely blown away by the quality (and volume!) of apps!

Hi!
As of Wednesday last week, I've now shipped all the KickStarter rewards that I can (apart from those that needed the new Puck.js), and the pre-orders from https://shop.espruino.com/banglejs are now shipped - that's over 1400 packages!
A bunch of you have received your Bangles already, and there's loads going on. Thanks to all of you that have contributed applications, fixes, or tweaks to the documentation  - it's all really appreciated and helps out all the other Bangle.js users. If you have problems, please have a look at the and ask on the forum at

Hi everyone,
As you've started receiving your Bangles, I've had several reports that the 'Bangle.beep' command doesn't appear to be working. Upon closer inspection it looks like the factory hadn't even installed the Piezo speaker in the affected watches.
I originally thought that these watches were the exception, but after having performed some testing here I now can't find a single watch with a speaker in. The first watches I tested before shipping definitely did have speakers in - which makes me think that at some point the factory ran out of speakers and then just stopped assembling watches with them and hoped nobody would notice.

We've been working non-stop packing boxes, and around 800 of you should now have got emails with tracking numbers. We're taking a break this weekend, but if all goes well we expect to ship the remainder of rewards that we can ship on Monday and Tuesday next week, and then pre-orders from the Espruino Shop at the end of the week.
There are one or two packages that have been a pain to ship because of the tool we're using to handle the postage (mainly those to Japan for some obscure reason, and the two workshop packs) and we will ship those manually soon.
Hi!

updates.update_userinfo: 📦Shipping Tomorrow📦 just 24 hours to order extras or change address
updates.update_content:
Hi!
We've been busy programming watches, and now have around 400 ready to go. We're just waiting for a few supplies to be delivered before we can get them in the post to you.
You can change your address on the KickStarter survey for another 24 hours, so if you need to make a change, please do it now!
I have just unloaded 64 boxes of Bangles (around 400kg worth!) from a DHL van.

Hi!
There are now 64 parcels full of watches (over 350kg worth!) on their way to me in the UK by express post. It's definitely the most I have ever spent on postage, but the parcels are travelling by air and should arrive in the UK early next week. I'll start programming them and sending them out to you a few days after that.
So it looks like, despite Coronavirus, you'll still get your watches on time!

updates.update_userinfo: The Pixel Chooser is now live!
updates.update_content:
Hi!
You can now chose and change the colour of your pixels on Bangle.js's about screen at https://banglejs.com/pixels
I've added some screenshots and a video to that page showing how to use it to choose your pixels. Sorry again for the shoddy-looking web page but it is something that's only going to be used this one time, so I've got it working securely and reliably but have otherwise focused my efforts on the real Bangle.js software that you'll use every day!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
After lots of work, we know we have the product design right, but there is always more to do!

We have a tight timeline and want to avoid delays, but we also won’t ship until everything’s perfect.

Production setup is always a challenging period. Manufacturers take time to refine processes, achieve efficiency and improve yields. Several trial runs are often needed.

The reliable and timely supply of components is often dependent on external market forces beyond anyone’s control. For this reason, we plan to commence procurement well in advance.

Things don’t always go to plan when it comes to innovation, but we have an experienced team. We know that intelligence and perseverance always wins.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Production Units, Winners Announced & Father's Day!
updates.update_content:
Production Update
In the past couple of weeks, we have received production plastics and have combined these with the PCBAs we received last month to make the very first Pokit Pro production units! We're thrilled to have the production units in our hands, and the Pokit design team is beginning to see the fruits of their labour!
We’ve had housing made out of three different plastics with varying thermal characteristics to find which type of plastic would work best, and our engineers have been busy putting the production units through thermal, electrical safety, and drop tests. The plastics have passed all our internal tests, which is a giant milestone achieved! We will need to make some slight modifications to the plastics tools, which we anticipated as it’s quite a common occurrence with the first production run of plastics.

updates.update_userinfo: Updating Addresses & Initial Production Almost Complete
updates.update_content:
Pokit Maker May
If you follow us on Instagram or Facebook (follow us because that’s where we update the most), you already know that this May is Pokit Maker May! We are running a competition to find the most creative Arduino project out there. To enter the contest, you must use the #PokitMakerMay and tag us so we can see your Arduino creation. These submissions can include the use of your Pokit Meter but aren’t a requirement for the build (although we’d love to see it).

Production units have finally arrived!
Over the past few weeks, we’ve been able to hit ‘GO’ on production, and are super excited to finally announce that our first 50 production PCBAs are in hand! Now that we're able to begin in-house testing on the PCBAs to ensure that they are functioning correctly, our focus will be shifting to testing multichannel functionality and ensuring that these production PCBAs are working well with the new Pokit App. All tooling for the plastic enclosures has been approved, and we should be receiving these in the coming week or two. We can’t wait to combine the two components and have our first complete production Pokit Pro units in our hands!

Our embedded software team is hard at work optimising the product's batter usage efficiency and are also working on determining how to best use the LED light to communicate information effectively to the user. The Pokit App team have been tidying up how Pokit Pro works as a single channel and have been eagerly awaiting the arrival of the production PCBAs to complete multichannel functionality, so they will be able to begin this now!

To see production images of Pokit Pro's PCBAs, take a look at our latest weekly update here:

To keep up to date with how we’re progressing with Pokit Pro week-by-week, be sure to check out the Pokit Forum every Wednesday for our weekly updates:

Production is well underway
Over the past month, we’ve primarily been focusing on getting production truly underway. We’ve finalised all designs, approved most of the tool drawings, and sourced all components. We can happily report that we have the initial batch of 50 units being produced as we speak and are expecting to have them in our hands in the coming couple of weeks, and we hope that this excites you as much it excites us! These will be used for beta testing and certification, and we’ll be sure to show them off once they arrive.

Off the back of our previous update, many of our backers have asked if we can provide more frequent updates with more detail.  In response, we’re happy to announce that we will be giving weekly updates over on the Pokit Forum, including detail of the things we’re working on.
Each Wednesday, we’re going to provide a progress update on what we’ve been working on for the previous week, along with any challenges we may have come across, and how we are overcoming these challenges.  We’ll also be sharing exclusive content in upcoming updates, including photos of different aspects of the development and production process and information that you wouldn’t typically find in our monthly updates.

With all the festivities well and truly over, the Pokit Team are charging full steam ahead into 2021. We can’t wait to see what this year hold, but for now, here’s a little insight into where we are at…

A Growing Team

Good news. We’ve just sent our designs off for production! Verification is complete and the tooling process has started. The ball is well and truly rolling on this updated Pokit Pro design.
Here’s all the boxes we checked over the past few weeks:

All prototype testing is done

Since our last update, we have completed Pokit Pro’s verification and we were moving into validation before tooling and production preparation. In the final stages of validation, we discovered a temperature problem.
A Thermal Dilemma
We found that when the unit was measuring 10 amps, the fuse would heat up and cause the unit to reach temperatures that would not allow it to pass the safety standard.

The Evolution of the PRO-totypes
We love getting parcels in the mail – it’s like a gift to ourselves. Especially when it is the NEW Pokit PRO prototypes. It’s great to see the improved design in the flesh, and naturally, we have been working hard over the past few weeks testing it out. 
We also wanted to give you all insight into the evolution of Pokit PRO. This gadget has gone through quite the refining process, thanks to your thoughtful input. Each rendition has required the team to put in a substantial amount of planning, problem-solving, and designing thinking. We’re pretty happy with the final result!

More info please!
Many of you were asking for greater detail on the issue we faced during verification testing of Pokit Pro. Well, here you go!
First off - if you haven't read the last update yet, we suggest you do that first. It provides the necessary background for the technical details below. Also, please note that this issue has now been solved! We're excited about moving forward and are thankful for your support and patience in this.
The Juicy Details

support.title: Thank You
support.descp: You will receive my undying gratitude and a 'Thank You' video from the pepper growers and salt producers of Kampot & Kep Provinces, Cambodia.

support.title: Organza Gift Bag (50 grams Kampot Black)
support.descp:
Try the best pepper in the world. Kampot black peppercorns. Includes the recipe for Tuk Meric the traditional Cambodian lime/pepper sauce.
"The thing that's really blown me away with this meal? That Kampot pepper and lime, Wow! That's great! Oh that's delicious!"
Anthony Bourdain, No Reservations

support.title: Ten of the best stocking stuffers ever
support.descp:
Now that we have reached our funding goal I want to put this new reward up to help us build a following for the Best Pepper Ever and the amazing Kampot Sea Salt. The money that we have raised (thank you everyone) will get us rolling but the long-term success of our 50 Million Meals Campaign requires pepper lovers in North America to try the Best Pepper Ever and to share it with their friends and families.
So I have created this new reward to 'STRETCH' our original goal and attract lots of folks to try the best pepper in the world and consider switching to our social purpose brand 'Best Pepper Ever' so we can really make a difference for the many families that are struggling to make ends meet. This reward includes 10 individual gifts of 12 grams of Kampot Black peppercorns and 12 grams of Kampot Sea Salt. This retail price for this reward is $30.00 and to build a following we are reducing the price by one-third. If you want more than 20 then just add two dollars per stocking stuffer.

support.title: Kampot Pepper-all three varities (-50%)
support.descp:
Kampot pepper comes in three varieties: black, white and red, all from the same plant (Piper Nigrum). The local climate offers perfect conditions for growing pepper and the quartz content of the soil helps to give Kampot Pepper its unique flavour.
The growing conditions are only one of several elements of importance to the production of Kampot pepper. Knowledge of pepper cultivation and production has been handed down from generation to generation since at least the 13th century and was first described by Chinese diplomat Zhou Daguan when he visited the area during the height of the Angkor Empire.
This gift pack includes 50 grams each of black, red and white Kampot Peppercorns and 50 grams of Kampot Sea Salt. This pledge is set at 50% off.

support.title: Kampot Pepper & Salt Grinder Set (2)
support.descp: This beautiful refillable Italian styled refillable glass grinder set contains Kampot black peppercorns and handcrafted Kampot Sea Salt

support.title: Kampot Salt & Pepper Grinder Set
support.descp:
Set of four refillable grinders. Once you have tried the 'Best Pepper in the World' there is no substitute. Anthony Bourdain was quoted as saying, " WOW. That's great. Oh! That's delicious"
This beautiful gift set has four Italian style glass grinders and has all three varieties of Kampot Peppercorns (black, red and white) and hand-crafted Kampot Sea Salt. It comes with a recipe for the Tuk Meric the traditional Khmer (Cambodian) pepper sauce that is simply delicious and very versatile - i add it to applesauce for roast pork, mix with fresh blueberries and mango for fish and even with cranberries for my holiday turkey. Wait till you try it.

support.title: Special Holiday Gift Pack (Half Price)
support.descp: This is a special offer for the holiday season. It includes forty individual organza gift bags. Ten gift bags of black peppercorns, ten white, ten red and ten Kampot Sea Salt each weighing 50 grams. The retail value is $420.00. A really great stocking stuffer for your friends and family. You can fill a lot off stockings with this pledge.

support.title: Corporate Holiday Gift Box
support.descp: We have just added this Corporate Gift Box for companies or folks who need to give a lot of small gifts this upcoming holiday season. This large gift box contains 80 organza gift bags. Twenty each of Kampot Black, Red and White peppercorns and twenty gift bags of Kampot Sea Salt. Value $840.00. This is priced at 40% off. Great for Holiday parties and special events. (PS: if you want to order items from the other pledges you can simply add the cost to your pledge and include a note as to which ones you want and there will be no additional shipping charge.)

support.title: Martin Luther King Font
support.descp:
You will receive the Martin Luther King Font for personal or educational use on your computers and mobile devices, a digital journal about the creation of the font and access to "Backers only" updates.
Optional—Make it personal:
Share your thoughts on Martin Luther King. Pen a personal statement relating to one of three questions about Dr. King and have your contribution published in a shared document that comes with the font. #1 “What is one societal impact that you have witnessed personally?” #2 “What is one universal value of Dr. King’s endeavours that is relevant today?” #3 TBD
INCLUDES:
Martin Luther King Font
Digital journal and access to "Backers only" updates.
Make it personal — get published in the documentation

support.title: Your Personal Typography Coach
support.descp:
You have a project in mind in which you like to use one of my fonts. For example designing a leaflet, preparing a school paper, t-shirt, a card or website. Harald Geisler will Skype, email or phone with you about the project. Based on your skill level, software and computer you use, he will create a tutorial to help you succeed. Afterwards the tutorial will be shared with all backers and everybody can learn from your case.

support.title: SILENT SUPPORTER
support.descp: Just curious about what's going to happen next? Toss us a buck to gain access to campaign updates.

support.title: VIRTUAL CITIZEN
support.descp: You receive a DRM-Free digital copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology.

support.title: GRASSROOTS CITIZEN
support.descp: You receive a trade paperback copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology.

support.title: CORNERSTONE OF THE COMMUNITY
support.descp: A limited edition numbered hardcover of the Last Cities of Earth anthology. This pledge level with be for books number 11 through 50 (out of a total of 50). The book will be autographed by artist, editor, and at least three authors.

support.title: PETER J. WACKS TUCKERIZATION
support.descp: Your name used for a character in Peter J. Wack's story in the anthology, plus a copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology in both paperback and DRM-Free eBook. Authors reserve the right to modify the name as needed to suit the story, coordinating with the backer to do so.

support.title: JOHN A. PITTS TUCKERIZATION
support.descp: Your name used for a character in John A. Pitts's story in the anthology, plus a copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology in both paperback and DRM-Free eBook. Authors reserve the right to modify the name as needed to suit the story, coordinating with the backer to do so.

support.title: DANIELLE ACKLEY-MCPHAIL TUCKERIZATION
support.descp: Your name used for a character in Raven Oak's story in the anthology, plus a copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology in both paperback and DRM-Free eBook. Authors reserve the right to modify the name as needed to suit the story, coordinating with the backer to do so.

support.title: HARDCORE ELITE
support.descp: A limited edition numbered hardcover of the Last Cities of Earth anthology signed by Jeff Sturgeon and ALL the editors and contributors, guaranteed to be number 2 through 10 (out of a total of 50).

support.title: PATRON OF THE ARTS
support.descp: Jeff Sturgeon will create an original 8" X 10" painting of the Last City of your choice featuring a unique view. Not a copy of the original art. You will also receive a paperback copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology.

support.title: TECHNICOLOR DREAM
support.descp: A limited edition full-color hardcover of the Last Cities of Earth anthology including reproductions of all the Last City paintings with their related stories, signed by Jeff Sturgeon and ALL the editors and contributors, numbered 1 through 10 (out of a total of 10). This edition will include a hand-drawn illustration by Jeff Sturgeon.

support.title: ART AFICIONADO
support.descp: You will receive one of the available original paintings that inspire the stories in the book, plus both a paperback and ebook of the anthology. Market price based on size is generally $3000 to $5000. Please see Gallery on the campaign page for available paintings. This is a first-come-first-serve reward. You MUST message the campaign after you pledge to claim the city of your choice.

support.title: Virtual Founder
support.descp: Beat the crowd and reap the benefits, score a DRM-Free digital copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology.

support.title: VIRTUAL CITIZEN
support.descp: You receive a DRM-Free digital copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology.

support.title: FOUNDER
support.descp: Beat the crowd and reap the benefits, score a trade paperback copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology at a reduced pledge.

support.title: RAVEN OAK TUCKERIZATION
support.descp: Your name used for a character in Raven Oak's story in the anthology, plus a copy of the Last Cities of Earth anthology in both paperback and DRM-Free eBook. Authors reserve the right to modify the name as needed to suit the story, coordinating with the backer to do so.

support.title: JODY LYNN NYE TUCKERIZATION

support.title: JEWEL OF THE COLLECTION
support.descp: A limited edition numbered hardcover of the Last Cities of Earth anthology signed by Jeff Sturgeon and ALL the editors and contributors, guaranteed to be number 1 (out of a total of 50). This volume will include a hand-drawn illustration by Jeff Sturgeon.

support.title: "BUDDY CAN YOU SPARE US TEN DIMES?" tier
support.descp: We're not sending you ANYTHING at this tier. Not even a thank you email if we can help it. You MAY get the joy of knowing you helped out a bunch of poor cartoonists who can barely buy cat food for dinner, but we're not doing anything to facilitate it.

support.title: THE ONE STEP FROM THE BOTTOM TIER!!
support.descp: Show your support for CEREBUS IN HELL? with this LIMITED TIME OFFER. For a meager 2 bucks or 8 quarters or 20 dimes or forty nickels or 200 pennies or 1 buck plus 4 quarters or 4 quarters and 10 dimes or WHACK!!! Ouch, sorry... It's the previously alluded to FAN POSTER. Once purchased all you have to do is supply the NAME (or TITLE) you want on it and an EMAIL ADDRESS to send it to when you fill out your survey at the end of this campaign. Get one for yourself, your friends, your mailman, your sister, your mom who wishes you would call more often, your WHOMP!!! Owwww, ok, ok. It's a nice way to show your support and get a COOL REWARD for just a little scratch and the BEST PART is YOU DON'T HAVE TO WAIT! Once the campaign is done the names will be added and emailed. No snail mail needed and you have that nice image with your name on it to hold you over while you wait for THE CANADIAN POST and your LPS (Local Postal Service) to mangle your @#$%ing FLIMSY POSTCARD FROM HELL!

support.title: BEAT TO HELL? tier:
support.descp: For $6, we'll send you a CIH? postcard. Printed on the flimsiest cardstock we can find! We're slapping a stamp on this bad boy and posting it ASAP. Is it going to get beat to HELL?!? YOU BETCHA! The card will be signed by Dave Sim and numbered by a !@#$ing computer, first-come, first-served, lowest numbers first!

support.title: IT'S THE 5 FOR THE PRICE OF 4 TIER!
support.descp: HEY! Want more than one FAN POSTER? How about 5 for the price of 4? THAT'S RIGHT! Order five of these babies for $8. You pick the NAMES, the TITLES, the DEROGATORY TERMS and WE do the rest (well, David Birdsong is putting the titles on and emailing them out, but we're with him in spirit). When choosing this option just remember to let us know when you fill out your survey at the end of the campaign who, what and where: Who's Name? What Email? (What's the "Where" for? Ain't we on the internet?). ORDER TODAY!

support.title: "DON'T DAMAGE MY @#$%ING POSTCARD" tier
support.descp: For $9 we'll send you the same flimsy post card described in the previous tier, but we'll send it in "MINT" condition! Still signed by Dave Sim! Still numbered by a !@#$ing computer! Packaged with a custom made bag and board. May still arrived damaged!

support.title: "A LITTLE CARD FOR MY FRIENDS" Tier
support.descp: What's that? You want the same bagged-and-boarded, machine-numbered, Dave-Sim-signed card as the "DON'T DAMAGE MY @#$%ING POSTCARD" tier, but with an extra FOUR signed-and-numbered cards included for your friends/lovers/confidants/Ebay purchasers? Well boy, do I have the tier for you! (This one). This pledge level will include FIVE signed cards, in a bag and board, sent to the SINGLE destination of YOUR choice!

support.title: "JUST CAN'T GET ENOUGH" Tier
support.descp: What's that? You want the same bagged-and-boarded, machine-numbered, Dave-Sim-signed card as the "DON'T DAMAGE MY @#$%ING POSTCARD" tier, but with an extra NINE (! What is this MADNESS??!) signed-and-numbered cards included, for your so send to your friends/lovers/confidants/Ebay purchasers? Well boy, do I have the tier for you! (This one). This pledge level will include TEN total signed cards, in a bag and board, sent to the SINGLE destination of YOUR choice!

support.title: "But I don't WANNA print my own!"
support.descp: For $60 we'll send you a BRICK of 50 POSTCARDS! Perfect for helping us promote CIH? at your LCS. Saves you the hassle of figuring out how to print your own postcard! If technology is TOO confusing for you, this is the tier for you! (Note: these are NOT SIGNED. These are NOT NUMBERED. These do NOT REALLY MAKE US ANY MONEY. These are a HAIL-MARY PASS attempt to get CIH? into more hands and more local comics stores!
